description:
Your typical hole in the wall pub food joint serving up a greasy array of burgers, sandwiches, fries appetizers and salads. The staff was friendly for our afternoon weekday lunch. A couple stray Giants fans were there for pregame festivities as well as businesspeople from the nearby warehouse district offices. Your best best here is a cold beer and a burger, however neither of those were on my wishlist (pescatarian and a lot of work sitting back at my desk). I ordered an iced tea to drink which was constantly refilled by the waitress. Our group started with mozzarella stick appetizers and potato skins. Both were a hit but nothing spectacular. For lunch I went with the grilled salmon salad. The portion size was very large but the salad was very blah. Lettuce, tomato, cucumber, onion, grilled salmon with the skin on, and balsamic vinaigrette. Flavor was lacking on the fish and I wish the salad would have had avocado, cheese, and or some summer fruit. It is served on a large plate but the salad was easy to finish as it was mainly just lettuce. Those who ordered bacon cheeseburgers at my table were much more satisfied and they could barely choke down half of their meal without loosening the belt buckles. 

Don't come here for the food, come here for the environment and to drink beer. A great sports bar. On the plus side, it's open for private events if you want to rent out the entire space.

UPDATE: we have all our boozy work lunches here. It's surprisingly popular. This time I went with the beet salad and added salmon. It was much better than the grilled salmon salad! Also had a glass of rose which was way too sweet for me but you can't really expect much in terms of wine at this establishment.
author: Kara N.

description:
Before I had kids. 
Before I worked around here.
Before i get into topic...
The whole staff here are awesome people.
As I was Born and raised in Frisco, this some what hole in the wall (which it isnt, its a pub) is at a best location (open to all). They Bring coworkers in and out to relax, take a shot, forget about today, etc.. this isn't a restaurant so theres no need to judge on food because you shouldn't expect a high end cuisine. If you are looking for that, go to the ones across the embarcadero st and spend your bougie money else where. They serve food here because they know you're hungry. Everything is basically American food. Beers are good, all liquour are poured equal, there are regulars and newbies, outside and inside seating, etc. 

Come to grumpys if you need a drink before you get on Bart and go home
Come to grumpys if you are hungry and thirsty during the lunch till 7pm. 
Also don't forget to look at the pictures on the wall before you go potty. :) 

Fyi: Don't come by over the weekends..
author: Jae R.

description:
I really enjoy my meal at grumpy's, it was my first time visiting and I was made to feel right at home. All the staff was very welcoming and professional. The food was delicious and I would definitely return and also bring others with me.
The location is great and even the other customers were very friendly this place gets a A+ in my book
author: Baron W.

description: My feelings towards Grumpy's are hot and cold. I'm not satisfied every time I go, but its location is perfect for whenever need a quick hot meal. The grilled chicken is good, however sometimes the bun isn't always fresh. The fried chicken with mac & cheese looks better than it tastes. Quite unfortunate because it has so much potential to be great. The food is hit or miss, yet I keep giving them my money. Lol. The price we pay for convenience.
author: Ali R.

description: I had a piece of tooth pick in my burger my friend had a hair in his, water tasted like dirt. Im currently trying to throw up, can i  put less than one star??
author: John B.

description:
Wow! It is so rare to get service like the service we received during a busy lunch hour, let alone any other time of day!  If I could give ten stars for the service at Grumpy's it still wouldn't be enough. 

We walked in the door to a packed room a little after 1 pm, but were seated right away. I had barely taken a breath before we received a menu and our drink order was taken. Another breath barely escaped my lips before the drinks were on the table. Kaboom!

Although the place was packed and music was playing, it wasn't too loud. In fact, it was just right. It was too cool to sit outside, but we got a table next to the front door which may have helped a bit with the noise level. Either way, it was just right. 

Our food came out almost as fast as the drinks and it was piping hot. To say that the chili cheese burger was good is an understatement. It was out of this world delicious. And the fries were so tasty! Hubby really loves his sandwich and onion rings too. 

Honestly, Grumpy's was quite the find and yet another reason that Yelp is the best! Thanks to Yelp for getting us Grumpy and thanks to Grumpy's for an awesome lunch.
author: VB L.

description: So not a 4 Star experience - get real here peeps - dive bar with nothing on the menu that you can't easily make on your own stove in 10 mins. Place is 2 stars at best - filthy inside and service comes with an decently sized attitude. Can do much better here Grumpy - give your joint an update and begin to smile a bit more - dive bars can do that
author: Matt T.

description: Fun little dive bar off of Battery Street. Great happy hour and friendly bartenders. Mostly hipster locals with a lot of cafe racers parked out front.
author: Michael C.

description:
Stumbled across this place on Yelp while looking for a spot to quickly grab some food and drinks before heading to the Exploratorium with my boyfriend. The place itself has a very authentic dive bar feel and a very friendly staff! 

We grabbed a seat at the bar on a Thursday evening right before Happy Hour ended and ordered a few drinks and a Pastrami Reuben with Garlic Fries. I don't know if I just super hungry, but that was probably one of the best Reuben's I've had! It was packed with lots of meat and great flavor. 

We were only planning on having one or two drinks there but ended up having quite a few more once we started talking to the bartenders and one of their regulars. Overall, we had really great conversation and a lot of fun hanging out at Grumpy's. I think we just found our new go-to spot. We'll definitely be back soon!
author: Kelci L.

description: Typical hole in the wall pub. I wanted quick food that would fill me up and that's exactly what I got. Burger was filling and beer was good. I was surprised at the wide array of burgers they had and were all $11-$15
author: Jasmine Ariel C.

description:
Solid three star lunch pub spot that I think I'd upgrade to four given the chance to experience a HH after work.

This place is a little bit removed from the hubbub of the rest of the city and while very relaxed and chill, quite popular during the lunch hour. We went on a nice day around 12:15 and the patio tables were already all taken, and there were just a few tables left inside. I'd say by 12:30 - the place was full.

It's good for your typical pub food - burgers, sandwiches, etc., but nothing that knocked my socks off. I succumbed to ordering a patty melt because a) it was Friday and b) I wanted something with fries.

Truth be told - I can make a better patty melt at home, but the fries were killer and it was nice to be out instead of having another sad desk lunch. 

I'll definitely try this again!
author: Jessica M.

description: Disappointed that they stop serving at 90 minutes before the post at closing time I really hate it when places say they're open till 10 but they stop serving at 8:30
author: Jonathan H.

description:
Randomly found this place on Yelp on a Thursday night. I wasn't expecting much but was surprised when we arrived. There were a ton of people there! I'm not sure if it was because of the Warriors game or if it's just a typical happy hour spot for people who work in the area. They had happy hour deals but we decided to just order off the menu.

My roommate and I both ordered a burger and fries - I got mine medium, French style (bacon and blue cheese). Mmmm... the patties were thick and juicy. Great burgers! We also ordered Stella and Boont on tap. Total was about ~$40 with tip for the both of us. Would definitely come back.
author: Xue Vee Y.

description: got a cheeseburger and it was delicious. garlic fries weren't that great but they had the nba playoffs playing and was a fun time overall
author: Emma T.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Monday. Place was empty and somewhat clean. The Irish lady was the only person serving the 3 tables occupied inside. 

I ordered the chicken strips ($8.50) and garlic fries ($4.50). Well, based on my pictures, do you think it's worth that much? I didn't either. What else was disturbing is that she gave me the silverware from the other table that was left dirty. Needless to say, I didn't use the utensils. Then as soon as her entire family comes in the bar, she leaves. Not finishing or notifying her guests that she was serving earlier. 

Anyway, I'd probably come back for a drink or two, but to eat? I don't think so.
author: Jenna T.

description: It's kind of an easy-going high-end dive bar that serves food. I think the neighborhood drives a lot of that. I was here during lunchtime on a Tuesday. There were a lot of office workers who looked like they enjoyed the break from the grind.
author: M G.

description:
This place was very chill. Came across it while on a trip in San Fran. Me and my boyfriend sat down on a table and waited nearly almost 5 minutes to be helped. I guess it's serve serve past 8 because my boyfriend has to physically get up and ask for drinks and pay them out. (I thought that was weird).

My boyfriend comes back, and I notice his glass is broken. He was to nice to go back and let the bartender know. Plus he doesn't believe in "wasting beer". So after his glass was empty I got yo to order the second round and let the bartender know the glass was broken. He laughed it off and didn't seem worried about it. The least he could've done was to get him a beer on the house. But no, that wasn't the case.

He was a very cool person besides that incident. He started talking to me in Spanish and he answered questions I had about the dollar bills that are stuck on the ceiling (which I thought was very cool).
author: Lizbeth M.

description:
Came here last Friday to attend my coworker's going away party around 1pm. The place was surprisingly crowded inside so we sat outside. we were a table of 9 and there was another table of 6 next to us. So there's plenty of seating outside. 

The server gave us our menus pretty quickly. Other than that, it took them a while to come back to take our orders. So one of my coworkers wrote what everyone wanted and brought it inside to our server. I've never been here before so I asked the coworkers for suggestions since they come here pretty often. They suggested the meatloaf sandwich. Having never eaten a meatloaf sandwich before, I decided to try it. 

When the food came out, I took a bite and thought it was just meh. The meatloaf seemed to be lacking in flavor for me. But the loaf of bread it came on was delicious. Perfectly toasted! The meatloaf sandwich also came with fries and those tasted pretty standard. We had a side of onion rings that I enjoyed a lot! Despite service being slow and inattentive in the beginning, after we got our food, our server came to check up on us plenty of times throughout the meal.
author: Cynthia T.

description:
I came here expecting to have a couple of drinks and a burger for dinner.  I had a scotch on the rocks, then left.

It was late afternoon, and the place was fairly empty.  I sat at the bar and the bartender (who was in conversation with another patron) could hardly be bothered to come over to ask me what I wanted.  When he deigned to do so, ordered my drink but he didn't ask me if I was interested dinner.  He went right back to his conversation with the other patron.  

While having my drink I had to tolerate two women (who must have flown in on their broomsticks) sitting next to me who work for a local media company.  Their not-very-subtle and not-very-quiet conversation was spent cattily ripping to shreds many of their female colleagues and external business partners.  In my ongoing effort to separate myself from poisonous people, I asked for my check, paid it, then left.

My two star review was not impacted by the two women (the establishment has no control over their patron's conversations).  It is because of the indifferent, unwelcoming attitude of the bartender.
author: David W.

description:
I stopped by here on the way to the Exploratorium Nightlife event with my boyfriend, hoping to get a little buzzed before the event and the place was packed - even though it was only around 6-6:30pm. I guess this place is pretty popular for happy hours for those working around the financial district. 

Service: 
Pretty spotty service as you order up front and then someone brings your food. Given that the place is always packed, expecting fast service isn't going to happen. It's always good to order a drink at the bar too so you can sip on something while you wait. 

Food:
I opted for something small since I wasn't sure how bar food was going to be like. 
Bacon Mac & Cheese: You can't go wrong with anything that has bacon on it. Even though it was listed on the "extra" section of the menu, the portion was pretty filling. I could barely finish the whole thing myself. It was toasty on the outside with a cheesy crunch which is the best way to make mac and cheese imo. The bacon was nicely scattered and gave it the salty goodness that goes superb with cheese. 

Drinks:
They didn't make jagerbombs with beer (which may or may not be an actual drink...) but they substituted it with coke which was good too. Jager + coke = no alcohol taste, so you can easily drink it like water..or soda. 

Overall: 
I would definitely come back if I'm in the area, parking can be hard to find though. I wished their kitchen is open for longer as they close it by 8pm so I can't come here to get the mac & cheese for my drunkies :(.
author: Annie V.

description:
I had a really, REALLY, great experience here with me and a few friends. We decided to stop by for a drink and some food before heading over to the exploratorium nightlife and I was blown away by the bartender, beer and food!

I will admit that the server wasn't on top of it, but then again, it was only him serving 20 patrons. We ordered at the bar (which they didn't seem to mind) and our food was out and hot within 10 minutes. I ordered the garlic fries which were perfect--and I'm pretty picky about my fries! They used real, minced garlic and sprinkled it over crispy fries that still had enough soft potato on the inside that would make you believe you were in heaven. I also got the Deschutes fresh squeezed IPA beer--would definitely recommend that. After I got it, and after it took its turn around the table, every one of my friends got up and ordered the exact same beer.

Overall, I would say I had a wonderful time here with my friends. Nice bartender, good food, seating available.. I couldn't ask for more.
author: Angelina H.

description:
After visiting the exploratorium my friend and I came here for dinner. 

The outside was crowded with people, but once inside their was plenty of space to sit and eat. The employees here we're really nice and friendly and we got our food rather quickly.

I got the pesto burger and it was a basic tasty burger. Nothing to special, but great after a long day of walking. However, shorty after I started throwing up and I had food poisoning for the next two days. I'm not sure if it was because this is mainly a bar and not much of a food place, regardless that food didn't settle to well in my stomach. If your looking for a drink I guess it should be fine if youre bothered by a huge crowd on a hot day, just don't eat here.
author: Shelbie C.

description: Ordered a breakfast burrito on Friday 10/13/17 around 8:15 AM.  The side of toast had clear mold on it (see attached picture).  Likely won't return.
author: Evan N.

description: Really cool little find on a side street up from the pier, felt really relaxed and at home, my boyfriend and I are from Australia and started walking randomly and was a super nice little place to chill and have a drink. Really enjoyed the retro music too!!
author: Nicole M.

description: Grumpy's is a real throwback kind of place. The decor feels very local and the staff is really friendly. Food is good pub food, fattening and delish. There are two large screen TVs and plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. Depending on what's going on in the area, parking is awesome!
author: Bruce R.

description:
Nice walkable distance from the Exploratorium side of Pier for food. I split the Western beef burger and Baja beef burger with a friend. We wanted garlic fries, but they're a whopping $2 more to substitute. 

Around $12 a burger with choice of fries, potato or mixed salad. The Western burger was good, reminded me an up-scale Carl's Jr western burger. The Baja had generous avocado, but lacked a kick of freshness I wanted it to have. Fries were classic thick cut, good for cleaning up the bbq sauce leftover on the plate.

I deprive this review of a 5 star because the service was slow giving us the check and though food was solid, it was not amazing. If the hamburgers buns were toasted and onions more caramelized then maybe...just maybe.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Staying around North Beach and Chinatown we've exhausted the normal touristy foodie places to eat. I was looking for something different and a local spot. So I found Grumpy's on Yelp. His place is in no man's land. Nothing around but business complexes. This is a local hangout and a true blue dive bar. 

We got here about 11:30 and the place is empty. We got our choice table. At about 12:15 then all the local came pouring in. Very relaxing but tight seating. 

I had the Chili Cheese Burger and fries. I read they had really good burgers here. Anyways, it's served open faced. Chili was homemade and was okay. Burger was just okay. Not a great meal. I guess I just didn't pick the right burger. 

My daughter had the Manhattan Melt with ham, turkey, lettuce, tomato, cheese on a grilled sour dough bread. Outstanding. Really good. They give you four huge piece. She got the potato salad on the side with this. Really good. Outstanding. Had a little kick to it. Yum yum good. 

My son had the meatloaf plate. Meatloaf was out of this world. Drop dead meatloaf. So good. Unbelievable. The homemade Mac & Cheese was okay. A little salty. The vegetables were so good and sweet. Outstanding dish. 

My wife had the chicken Cesar salad. She really like it a lot. Very good

Anyways, service was very good. Water cups were filled in a regular basis. I accidentally spilled my water cup (can you say clumsy) and we had two waitresses cleaning it up right away. That's what I call good service. 

So if your looking for a local spot away from all the touristy places. Somewhere out of the way but not that bad of an area then this is the place for you. Just be careful of what you order. Read the Yelp reviews first then order. Enjoy.
author: Doug T.

description:
Quick Review:  Don't be fooled by the fact that this is a bar, it's also a great food spot.  They have the best turkey burger I have ever had.  I've ordered turkey burgers from other places and nothing has been as good as Grumpy's.  I highly recommend you try this place out!

FOOD
Western Burger with Garlic Fries (Turkey, lettuce, tomato, onions, bacon, cheddar)...$11.50

Starting with the turkey patty, its was so moist and seasoned perfectly.  It somewhat tastes like chicken, which is great because turkey is a little leaner of a meat.  Next the bacon, it came with around 3 slices.  I loved the fact that the slices of bacon were actually cooked completely through, it's horrible when there is that layer of fat that you get a little piece of and want to vomit after (maybe that's just me).  The shoes string onions were great, nice and thin and not overpowering.  

SERVICE
I went here with my friend for lunch during a workday.  Previous times there were a ton of people and a little wait but surprisingly we were seated right away.  We ordered our food and within 10-15 minutes it arrived at the table.  Someone checked in twice for water refills.  Overall the service was good.  

AMBIANCE
It pretty darn cool in there.  It doesn't look like a place that you would want to eat at, meaning it looks more like just a bar.  There are pinned dollars on the ceiling where you can write a not on the dollar and they put them up up there.  Dark work and fully stocked bar.
author: Brittany S.

description: Kevin is an outstanding bartender and the mushroom and Swiss burger with fries was outstanding.
author: Scott T.

description: If you are looking for a good burger and a beer you won't be disappointed here.  One large section of their menu is dedicated to all the variations on their chicken, turkey, portabella or beef burger that you can choose from. My favorite is the downtown burger with sour cream, grilled mushrooms and onions. This is the place for my favorite onion rings. The side salad with their house balsamic is always a good choice too. The only reason I don't rate it higher is because the acoustics are terrible and they tend to play the music way too loud. Makes it really hard to have a conversation with your colleagues during your lunch hour. Service is good. Not always exact. If you try to make too many substitutions the cook seems to get confused. The only dish that is inconsistent is the salmon salad. Often times the size of the salmon is too small and/or overcooked. Good pub food.  Full bar.  Something for everyone.
author: Jennifer F.

description: First time here, worked in downtown forever... This is a good place for some good Fry Chicken, mac and cheese could have been warmed up more plus vegetables were very good/steamed however, my friend said last time she was here the vegi's were roasted, if so, I would have given this place an extra Star....  Very busy place for a small building filled with customers.  Staff is as good as they can - hope they make a good salary as they have to work hard here catering to mostly neighborhood workers and a bit of tourist...  I'd go back again for some Good Fry Chicken!
author: Betty L.

description:
The staff was very friendly and promptly brought us menus and drinks. We went the day after Christmas, and it was obvious that they were normally much busier. 

They have a bacon mac and cheese that puts others to shame, and their burgers were amazing. Out of our group we ordered the Angus, turkey, and veggie burgers, all of which were cooked perfectly and tasted great with the unique toppings they offered.

I don't think they could have made us feel more welcome. The location is accurate to describe as divey. It is that kind of dive that you love going to with friends or family.
author: Ben B.

description:
It's Friday and I AM GRUMPY.

Grumpy that all the FB posts lately and all this weekend will be about EDC in Vegas. That or people thinking that they're sportscasters for the night.

Grumpy that everyone and their mama, baby's mama, baby's daddy are at EDC (I don't even like raves) right now as I type.

Grumpy that everyone has an excuse to act a drunken hot mess at EDC and I'm sober.

Grumpy that everyone has an excuse to whore out at EDC as I sit here in my granny panties.

Yah SO I'm just a grumpy jealous beezie today but thankfully not as grumpy as Kim Kardashian and Kanye's daughter will be in 16 years...

Who da eff names their kid "North"? North West? WTF!

Oh yah, btw the buffalo wings at Grumpy's are kick ass and they have real dollar bills stuck to the ceiling: http://bit.ly/16m0v9n! Holla!

OTHER NOTES:
*Older FiDi crowd w/ no eyecandy.
*Divey pub with a full menu ($3.95-$10.95); from breakfast foods (served till 11 am) to salads, sammies, signature burgers, fried chicken and chili.
*HH is Monday - Friday, 5 pm - 7 pm
--Snapshot of online HH menu: http://bit.ly/12REr8w
--$1 Garlic fries on Monday - Wednesday
*No waiter service. Place your food order at the bar.
*Buffalo Wings ($5.95) were some of the best I've had: http://bit.ly/183kxtt! Their crisp and juicy and the sauce is indescribably tangy and spicy with a touch of smoky sweetness.
*Decent drinks. Stiff Hendrick's Tonic was $8.
*Very clean restrooms w/ Dyson hands-free dryers.
*Odd operating hours. Closes at 10 pm AND they're closed on the weekends. WTF?
*Be VERY careful as you're crossing the streets in the surrounding area; there are no stop signs and cars drive by really fast. 
*Very easy street parking.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Total ad bar as proven by the many namesakes on the walls but every good ad bar has an equally good hangover menu because ad people, well they drink.

For a hangover, there can be fewer better things than the super burger. Juicy burger done the way you like it topped with cheddar cheese, bacon, and a fried egg. Some call it breakfast, I call it recovery. For less woozy days, explore their many other burgers. I like the Popeye - sautéed spinach and feta cheese. Decent pub food overall. They have decent fish and chips here although the wait for that during lunch was really long. Speaking of waits, forget about getting a table during happy hour as Grumpy's will be packed with folks enjoying post-work happy hour specials like a beer and a shot for $7 Mon-Wed.

Decent pub with equally good pub grub that is worth a stop in if you're looking for a watering hole in the neighborhood. Just be warned that it does get very crowded on weeknights.
author: Jon L.

description: a great place to come before exploratorium after dark.  cheap drinks.  pbr and a shot on happy hour was i think 8$? something really good.  their food is delicious too.  had a burger with fries for about $10 and it had avocado and mushrooms in it.  big portions.  for a divey lil place its really good.  a few tvs for the sports games.  i will come back.  full bar and lots of beers on top.  a great gem found through yelp.  yayy!
author: Matthew G.

description:
still crashing parties here and loving it.
This place rocks, I've had the time of my life here and some great memories as well.
This bar should be in some famous tv show for all its coolness its got.

I love the happy hour ah its not too cheap but the drinks are great.

The bathroom actually has a lock and is clean.

Both are things that are rare in the bar scene in sf.

This is a great place for work parties. 
The food here is good.

Its great bar food.
author: Luke S.

description: Cheap drinks, really good burger and garlic fries, service was fine.  I don't get why they'd let children in there, as it seems more like a dive bar, but they do. Would definitely go back if I was in the area.
author: Jorge O.

description: It's a dive bar.  That doesn't stay open late and have decent burgers.  If you are looking for more than that, start hiking.  And you are going to have to walk a while for there is not much around.  Suck it up, go in for a beer/whisky and burger, and get surly with the locals.
author: Larry W.

description: I ordered the bacon cheeseburger and onion rings. Ooooh they were delicious, they use angus beef patty, it was so tender and juicy , the onion rings melt in your mouth, and don't forget about the bacon it was very tasty. The employees were very nice, they said we are family now, please come back. We are from Stockton, Ca.
author: Maceo A O.

description:
Note to self. No set kitchen schedule for dinner. If the happy hour hipsters aren't ordering food they close the kitchen. 
Still love them, we'll just plan better.
author: Us And J.

description:
Great turkey burger (Cafe Burger), funny bartender, and decent atmosphere. 

The scene was a little yuppie for me but it's close to the FIDI so I wasn't too surprised. Since the Warriors are doing well there were a lot of bandwagon fans there which added to the noise. All in all the foods great and the drinks were flowing. My girl was comped a beer because the tap ran out ¾ of the fill. Had fun on my first visit and will be back soon. TRY THE MAC N CHEESE!!!!
author: Jam R.

description: Great little hidden "beer and a shot" dive bar near Levi's plaza.  Stopped for a break and got a great "super" burger topped with bacon and fried egg.  Good meat and nice side salad with homemade balsamic dressing.  Since it was Happy Hour I walked out with a full meal including a beer and generous tip all in for $21.  Very friendly bar tender.  This is the place to counter all the "SF is so expensive" whiners who don't know where to go for bargains.  I'd give them an extra star if they were open weekends.
author: Howard D.

description: We love Grump's American Pub! The best place in San Fran! It's a hidden gem. If you're in San Fran, you must go!
author: Yale S.

description: Stopped here to grab a burger and beer for lunch. Great burger - juicy and mouthwatering. The garlic fries were on point as well. It's a bit of a splurge for a lunch but I would go back.
author: Steve S.

description: We were looking for a snack and beer before our dinner at Coquetta. We used Yelp to find Grumpy's.  It is a local Gastro Pub with great chili fries, Anchor Steam on tap, and affordable drinks. The other food looked so good we considered skipping Coquetta. But Coquetta was fantastic. It was a nice Friday evening in the City.
author: Dana L.

description: Basic pub food.  We had the turkey burger santa fe style which was excellent with avocados and sprouts. Fries were good. My husband liked the mac and cheese (although I thought it was bland and could use more seasoning). Nice ranch salad dressing, but the salad that comes with the burger is  really small, so if you want a salad, get one on the side.  Place could use a thorough cleaning, as it did smell like beer, and those little gnats were flying around our table.
author: Melodie H.

description: Horrible over priced food. Want to vomit right now after eating there. I feel like I was ripped off and food poisoned.
author: Michael F.

description:
The cooks were unwilling to make an egg sandwich, b/c it was 5 minutes after 11am. There was only 2 other people in the restaurant who had just been served breakfast. The bar tender was very nice, but the cooks have absolutely not customer service skills.  They were so unwilling to simply fry one egg and put it between toast. The bar tender asked, then the cook looked right at me and said no.
I will never step foot in this old SF grub/drink spot again! I have told anybody and everybody at my work, which is a block away, to not give that kitchen any of their business. With cooks who have no care for the customers... you are better off eating anywhere else.
author: R S.

description:
definitely a dive bar feel

about 12 brews on tap and another 12 in bottles - decent variety

I ordered the fried chicken ($14 with tax), and the guy next to me highly recommended it
fried chicken: had virtually no meat and was just fried bits
vegetables: best part of this entire meal, veggies were pretty heavily buttered
mac and cheese: definitely more of a soupy mac and cheese, wouldve preferred velveeta over this

caters towards the local ad agencies. if there were other options in this area, i would definitely seek them out. but alas there aren't
author: Jackie W.

description:
Awesome hole in the wall pub!

Randomly stumbled upon this place on yelp and decided to come here for dinner, after discovering Sushirrito closed after lunch.. It was packed, but we were quickly seated. 

There was only one person working taking care of drinks at the bar, taking orders, and bringing out food, and he still came by promptly to bring us all ice water and take our orders. Our food came out relatively quickly too. Service was superb!

The food was delicious too. I got the cheeseburger with the fried egg and it was cooked perfectly. Definitely hit the spot after a long day of roaming SF.

The interior is pretty small and very dark - a typical pub-like feel. There are a bunch of bills stuck on the ceiling and the tables are in a tight arrangement. Felt a little dingy, but what pub doesn't?

All in all, great find and not to mention it's a short walking distance from the pier! Took a nice stroll afterwards to walk off our meal and got to see the gorgeous bay bridge in all its lit up glory. Definitely should give this place a try!
author: Hye-Min O.

description: I've been coming here for years and I will ALWAYS be a Grumpy's regular. I've worked around this bar for 8 years and have made many friends and memories here. Naomi isn't there anymore, but she was wonderful! Alan is THE MAN. The rest of the staff is absolutely wonderful and I assure you that you'll feel like family when you walk in. The food is super tasty and comfort food. The drinks are superb. Love this place if you're in the area and want a cocktail and some lunch. Also they have outside seating which is great on those beautiful SF days.
author: Katie G.

description:
I went there on vacation just because I thought the name was funny... What a surprise a great traditional bar with a good craft beer selection. Friendly staff and clientele made it a very nice experience. The bar has a dark wood style interior with a mirrored Victorian style bar which gives a great traditional feel.

Food is bar food, we only had sandwiches but what we had was presented well and very good. 

We highly recommend this place and it's not just a funny name 
The bar is very good value for the San Fran area and I highly recommend it
author: Nathan M.

description: Went here for a quick bite before going to the exploratorium for the day. I had a Baja burger with garlic fries. The burger was decent and their regular fries were nice and crispy. But the garlic fries are not worth it... it's just regular fries with a teaspoon of garlic paste on top. The paste made the fries a bit soggy... and it wasn't even tossed with the fries, just placed on top of them...
author: Lily L.

description: Stopped here to grab something to eat while we were in town. I had a BLT (which I was very happy with) and a side salad. I was given the wrong dressing but they fixed it. Hubby ordered a hot dog and they brought out a chili dog. They fixed it with no hassle, however, the big reason I'm giving a 3 star is they reused either the bun (which still had chili on it) and/or the hot dog and cleaned it off. I'm thankful my husband doesn't have allergies. I would caution the chef to NOT do this in the future. Could be a major problem if this happens regularly and customers are unaware.  If we're in the area another time we'll come by again.
author: Jessica F.

description:
Just awful. We grabbed it to go through our office and I had to throw away my "Greek" salad. I say "Greek" because the salad was sloppy and didn't have the standard dressing for this style of salad. Also, we had called the order ahead of time and asked them to label all of the orders, which they did not. 

Half of us (there were 6 of us) ended up throwing half of our orders out and to be honest after the awful customer service we had, I wouldn't try them again. Perhaps their drinks are better, but to be blunt, why bother going in when they're not even inviting?
author: Carolina S.

description:
A good place for burgers.  I tried Veggie burger and it was really good.  Good sides too (fries, onion rings).  The interior is pretty small. Good service, pricey.

It is interesting to see paper money pinned to ceiling!  I don't remember seeing it anywhere.
author: Srinath S.

description: Good food and great service.  Try their cheeseburger.  It's awesome.  The wings and garlic fries are also really good.  There aren't a lot of places like this nearby so it's great for an after-work meetup.
author: Jay R.

description: Paper money pinned to ceiling, small and intimate restaurant and bar and good service. A girlfriend and I came here before a holiday gathering and everything was pretty good. There were specials, beer on tap and a decent amount of liquor to choose from. A cool spot tucked away from the rush of The Embarcadero.
author: Bernadette M.

description: Definitely a full pub atmosphere but I came in for a beer and a bite to eat after visiting the exploratorium and I have no regrets! Very refreshing beer, great food that came out fast, and the bartender had great hospitality!
author: Mekenna J.

description: Had a Hamm's Beer here once. I'd give the Hamm's a 5/5 for crisp refreshing taste, but I'd also give Grumpy's a 5/5 for food, bartending prowess, and atmosphere.
author: Garrett L.

description: never thought id utter this sentence ....but Grump's is the shit !!! get the mac and cheese !!
author: Micah W.

description:
Went here to watch the final game between the Heat & Spurs with a co-worker. The crowd seemed pretty chill and liked the atmosphere but it was hard to get around with so many people. 

They charge a fair price for their draft beers and their menu offers a good variety of food. I decided to get Lagunitas IPA on draft + a cheeseburger with fries.

The beer was cold and refreshing with the burger. The burger itself was seasoned adequately and hit the spot. While it wasn't anything out of the norm it was done well and I had no complaints. 

Overall Thoughts

A good place to grab a bite and drinks with friends
author: Eddie W.

description: Excellent food, atmosphere and very friendly place. Great after work place to go relax and get rid of the work stress.
author: Richard R.

description: Looks like the place has a great beer selection - diverse local and global brands in a range of types - but food seemed jus OK.  Burger was kind of dry and not much on flavor. Onion rings were pretty good though. Next time I'll go for the bar rather than lunch.
author: Mark A.

description:
Good burgers...it was weird that they preferred to watch college students play basketball versus watching a professional baseball team play their first game.

But good burgers.  And their taps were off.
author: Damen S.

description: Good place for a quick bite and a ball game.  Nice atmosphere with a good selection of taps to choose from.  Extensive menu of burgers, salads, and sandwiches that where not half bad.  It's kinda off the beaten path which is what caused us to stop and have a bite.   Good service and friendly staff.   Enjoy a pint or two!!
author: John V.

description: Good burgers - actually, really good burgers. Service is spotty but friendly when you get their attention.
author: Michael G.

description: Check your Credit Card statement after eating here. They added $1 to my tip. It's so minor and I wouldn't have caught it if it wasn't a business expense. If they are willing to skim tips, what other things are they will to do to there customers?
author: Tyler D.

description: Like dive bars. Like to find places where there're no tourists even though I'm  one. This fit perfectly. Great western burger, great atmosphere, great bartender who warned me that jalapeño poppers and a burger may be too much food. (He was right). Upgraded to garlic fires - well worth it. The bartender was the best. Will definitely relax a night here when I'm back in town.
author: Mason M.

description:
Not that I'd expect anything different from a pub/grungy bar... but holy cow were those burgers greasy! Were they good? Yes! But after finishing off an entire western bacon cheeseburger and onion rings (I was hungry...), I've been full for the last 12 hours. No joke. It's a heart attack on a plate. Specialty burgers are $10.50 + extra if you want onion rings. 

The services leaves much to be wanted. The tables are gross. The place is a bit of a hole in the wall, but the place seemed busy and popular so the crowds can't be wrong, right?

The food is good, but i wouldn't call it the best bar food i've ever had. The onion rings were again good but not great. i'd come back again if a friend wanted to go but I wouldn't come back on my own. Given the ambience and the sopping wet hamburger bun (From absorbing all that grease! I am telling you!), I deduct another star from what I would call a fun but mediocre place for food.
author: Stef S.

description: Really good pub food and very friendly staff. My company has hosted several happy hours here and it's always been a blast. Great place to unwind after work or grab a good burger for lunch.
author: Ron B.

description: Had breakfast with the family.  Great food, nice people, cozy atmosphere
author: Resturant P.

description:
I order to go all the time for work lunch, but last night's service was a little ridiculous. The owner was hosting a private party with 7 people in the back of the restaurant and had the only server and bus boy completely focused on him and his group. That left the poor bartender, who was super nice and was doing his best to get us square away, to serve our party of 6 plus the few other couples that wandered in. We weren't more than 5 feet from the bar, but it meant that every time we wanted to order a drink or order  appetizers that we had to go up to the bar and put in the order. After the first 30 minutes, the bartender then came out and took our dinner order (to be honest, it was when he realized that no one else was going to do it who should have been taking care of us and took it upon himself to fix it). 

When I have to watch someone polish wine glasses and set a table with candles and a white table cloth while waiting 15 minutes for someone to come over and ask if we want a drink  - there's something wrong. Oh and did I mention that we even started to bus our own table? Meanwhile, there were custom made plates of off-menu items being rolled out to his private party.

I hope that the owner reads this - and DO NOT take it out on your bartender, not his fault and he was flawless with us. Close down your place if you're hosting a private dinner party or go take them out to somewhere else where it doesn't disrupt your business.
author: Alita M.

description:
DISCLAIMER: I'm rating Grumpy's as a vegetarian. The atmosphere was great and the rest of the my party enjoyed their dishes.

I had the veggie burger. It was one of the worst I've had. Almost definitely frozen, thin patty, disappointing bun. Left me hungry and underwhelmed. Besides the veggie burger, I can't even remember any other non-meat options. 

Please add veg dishes!!
author: David Z.

description: Fries, burger, onion rings, beer, and nice service. This is a hidden gem in that area if you are meeting friends after work, waiting to meet up to go to the exploratorium, or just are in the area.  They do a good job with the bar food and having reasonable priced drinks. I don't know what expectations people have going to this place, but I assumed it would be a fake dive bar that would be overpriced due to the area and I was pleasantly surprised by how relaxed the atmosphere was.
author: Lily P.

description:
What a little tucked away hot spot this is. Open the door and the place was filled. Every plate looked good. The staff were very friendly and accomadating. I came with a friend in a wheelchair, and they were great at creating a space for us in this cramped restaurant. A great mix of a bar and good food. 
Ordered a burger which was big, juicy and delicious with bacon and blue cheese. Only complaint was a small amount of French fries. I want to come back and sit at the bar for a drink.
author: Matt A.

description:
This review is for lunch only.  I havent tried it for drinks...yet. Walking in you see that it's not a very big restaurant but feels more homey than bigger pubs. We noticed that the ceiling had lots of dollar bills pinned to it. We were told that it has to do with happy hour held long ago.

Our server was friendly. I ordered the tuna melt, mac n cheese and fries. The mac is your typical pub mac and cheese. Runny cheese sauce poured on top of elbow macaroni with a sprinkle of black pepper. Tuna melt was better than average. Layered with caramelized red onions and cheese. Tuna is browned on one side which adds dimension to the taste as opposed to your typical tuna heated on bread with cheese. Fries were typical too. Kinda soggy.  The tuna melt was the winner and will bring me back.

If you're looking for a more cozy pub, check this place out.
author: Shell I.

description:
Favorite burgers in town, if it's your first time, try the Baja or better : the super
The others are good too but these two are the best.
They accept to split the burgers in half as well which is great if your stomach is small :)
author: Gregoire V.

description:
I had a really disappointing experience at this restaurant today. I should add that I am a vegetarian, but I found that they do happen to have a few solid options on their menu. That being said, the overall experience fell very short. 

I arrived with my group, and asked what was in their veggie burger, and they had absolutely no clue. I don't really feel like paying $15 for some questionable frozen patty when I go out to a restaurant. You should know what ingredients are in your products, even if they aren't made in-house. Weird moment #1. 

I decided on a Portobello mushroom with some yummy-sounding burger fixins on a bun, along with some zucchini fries. Shortly after, they bring out drinks for everyone (they had all ordered beer, lemonade, etc.), but didn't bring any water for me to the table. I know we're in a drought, but they could have at least asked if I'd like water when I placed my order. Weird moment #2. 

About 15 mins after we order, someone comes out and informs me that they're out of Portobello mushrooms. Normally this wouldn't be a huge deal, although it's a little disappointing, but it would have been nice to know sooner. I decided to switch to a beet salad with a side of zucchini fries. Weird moment #3. 

Finally we received our food, and the salad was ok, but ultimately I could have made it at home. It was a lot of spinach and shredded carrots, with very few beets, and hardly any Gorgonzola. Literally a tiny sprinkle of cheese...come on that's the protein! It's the equivalent to getting one little slice of chicken on a Caesar salad. To make matters even worse, they never even brought me the zucchini fries. So I literally received 0% of the food I had originally ordered. Even if they took it off the bill, it was just a bad experience. Weird moment #4, and I was done. I politely paid for my meal, left a small tip, and will not be returning.
author: Jackie G.

description: The Baja burger was perfect, first time here great local dive bar. The name says it all.
author: Sean C.

description: Found this place because I didn't want to pay for expensive food at the exploratorium. I ordered the downtown burger, which had mushrooms, grilled onions, cheese, red onions, tomato, lettuce, a patty, topped with sour cream, with a side of fries. I had an interesting experience with the burger. I think the sour cream just overwhelmed everything and emphasized that part of the burger too much. However, what got to me was the patty. A burnt patty did not look appetizing to eat, nor did it taste good either. The outer edges of it were crispy  and black, which kind of killed the burger. The fries were pretty good though, I mean you can't mess up fries that badly right? But yeah they said this and another burger was the most popular. So if you ask them what their most popular burger is and they mention the downtown burger, you may want to get the other one instead. I didn't think it was worth over $10 for.
author: Ryan C.

description: It's hard to get a consistent burger here. Unfortunately, it hasn't been all that great the past few times I've gone. The outside of the burger was overdone, while the inside was still raw.
author: Alan B.

description: I was feeling pretty upset and started wandering around and happened upon Grumpy's, and my foul mood was soothed with a great burger and a beer. Life's simple things.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Our group of 3 Asians placed our orders at 12:10 PM.  We've sit patiently and waited for over 30 minutes and none of our orders arrived, while customers arrived AFTER us already got their orders served.  Checked with the waitress and was promised that our orders would arrive in 2 minutes.  Waited all the way until 12:55 PM and still no food, and no apology.  The waiters were smiling at us when we walked out of the restaurants, again with no apology whatsoever.  It's unacceptable and we would not go back there to be discriminated again!
author: Bill L.

description: I find myself near Grumpys around lunch time for work.  The service and food is consistent, pretty good and reasonable making it a solid choice for lunch.  But I think they really shine as a bar.The beers are always cold; poured and served right!!the bartenders are friendly and even when the place is crowded they do a great job of not making it feel like a pain to get a drink.  The crowd is great, I can never tell if it's locals or people that work local but it is a good mix of regulars types with after work groups and some plain old partners.
author: Brian O.

description: They claim to be open until 10pm,  I took a cab here, craving a burger and arrived at 9pm on a Friday only to find out they had closed the kitchen!  Be forewarned.
author: James B.

description: Good service, nice ambience, and great drinks! It wasn't that crowded on a Monday night, which I don't mind at all. It's a nice place to chill with the game on and alternative music playing. I was there for the happy hour which had only drinks, no food despite the website.
author: Jamie L.

description:
BREAKFAST !!
- if you dare :-) seriously, they serve up a great breakfast (bacon galore) even if you don't have a hangover, you should try it out
author: Mike W.

description:
After my last visit, I don't think I'll be going back. I went in to order some food to go. I knew what I wanted, but it was extremely difficult to get the bartender's attention. When he finally asked and I said I wanted to order food, he stopped me and said, "then hold on" and proceeded to serve customers behind me. Didn't offer me a menu or an excuse. Even the customers behind me said, "but the young lady was in front!" The bartender said, "that's fine" and proceeded to take their orders first. I ordered fish & chips and got a non-itemized bill for $11.91 (menu price is $7.95). Even with taxes, that seems excessive, but at that point, I just wanted to be out of there, so I didn't argue, just paid and left.

Also, don't even bother deciding on a salad. The menu lists 12 salads, but every time I tried to order a salad other than Caesar or Chef's, I was told they don't have it.
author: Sabina U.

description:
I was very pleasantly surprised by my visit to Grumpy's!  We were starving, after eating a gross 2 bites of breakfast at 11am, and made our way into Grumpy's around 5pm.  I ordered us some onion rings to get the hunger edge off, and they were cooked perfectly and very tasty.  Next, we both ordered some burgers.  I'm not gonna lie, I had low expectations for this random pub that was a little bit grungy all by itself on a random street in SF.  The burger, though, was AWESOME.  It was perfectly cooked, very tasty, and hit the spot nicely.  ANNNND...I'm about 90% sure that it was NOT just because we were starving.  I had the western burger, and BBQ sauce on it was great, particularly in combination with the bacon, cheddar, and onions.  Very good show, Grumpy's...

My friend had the California Burger (I think), which was decidedly less epic, but still cooked to perfection, juicy, and tasty...

The fries were pretty good, and the bar staff were super friendly, both in taking orders, answering questions about the menu, and in answering our questions about the cable cars and other touristy things.

Well done, Grumpy's.  You exceeded my expectations, and I thank you for that...
author: Brian B.

description: Best dive burgers! Just get a regular cheeseburger and a pint of beer. You will not regret it!
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Friend : dude she's not your type. She has really short hair and sorta ehhhh looking.
Me : I know but she's different and somewhat cute. It's not the jameson talking either. It's the inner beauty we should be looking for right? We all get the old bro.
Friend: shut up, drink some more and stick with your cougars

I usually dont go to bars like this. the crowd is generally older, loud, divey and small. But check this out, they were showing some old school break dancing moves on the flat screen and sometimes a cult movie is on. dollar bills on the ceiling? what the heck? kevin the bartender is extremely friendly and remembers multiple drinks with changes on the fly. it does get really busy and most of the time its either and one or two man show. burgers are juicy and cooked like the way you want them at home. and can i custom order crazy stuff? how about garlic onion rings, and garlic fries with bacon! dayam....... imma be buzzed and my breath smell? no clubbing fo rme tonight. this place might look a little weird but has great character. and thats what all "i" should be looking for.
author: Q L.

description:
Had a chance to try breakfast at this North Beach eatery the other day and decided to write up a review.  Mo's is a neighborhood diner that serves up classic American breakfast without pomp or panache.

We chose it for a business meeting and it turned out to be the right choice!  Friendly service, great job on the eggs and potatos and kept the coffee coming -- what more could you ask for?
author: Andrew G.

description:
A classic western pub of brick and glass. This is a square room smelling of beer - nothing wrong with that. There are beers for every taste, including old-school PBR and Olympia in bottles. I would have been really fired up to see Oly in a can, as it was  the first beer I ever had. 

Sadly, I had to settle for iced tea, as I was at lunch with co-workers. The food was pretty good and the portions large. I had a "Manhattan Melt" - ham, turkey and Swiss. It was really just a club sandwich, but still tasty. And it was served with a savory, heaping helping of potato salad.
author: Steve L.

description: Good place to eat. Just up the street from the Exploritorium. It wasn't busy at all when we went. Great sandwich and good service.
author: Jessica R.

description: If this was the kind of place with friendly people, and they could make a decent Hamburger, and you could get a no fuss beer at 4PM for $5 bucks including tip, it would have a nice neighborhood bar charm. But it's not, they can't, and you will need to shell out at least 40% more than that. Very limited reasons to come here. Pressed to think of one, I'd say if you're looking for the lower standards and banality of a trip down I-5 without the hassle of leaving the city, may be your kind of place.
author: Luke M.

description:
Thank you Grumpy's for your fight to remove Off the Grid from our lunch-less neighborhood.  Thanks to you my options have whittled back down to approx 1 subway, 1 sandwich spot and 2 cafes.  such a plethora of options, it's fantastic!  You guys are assholes.

p.s. I haven't eaten at your restaurant in 2 years due to the poor quality of your burgers and limp frozen french fries.  Double disappointment.
author: Millie A.

description:
I used to work a few blocks from here. The burgers are great! however..

Watch the bill!  -------- ! ! !

I chalked it up to being so close to the heavily touristed Embarcadero area, but this place will rip you off!

THE CASH REGISTER IS PROGRAMMED FOR MATH ERRORS. More than once I saw $10+$6=$18. They also have a habit of ringing you up for $12 when you order a $10 burger. If you call them on it, they will say "oops, I rang you up for the macaroni". When it happens once, you wonder. When it happens twice, you know it's a racket.

Especially dangerous for groups! Look at the bill carefully.

Like I said, the food is great. Just watch the bill. 

Someone needs to inspect the cash register. Who is the responsible entity for doing that?
author: David A.

description:
Fun place near work - if you're at William Sonoma or Levi's plaza.  Bit of a gem for the area to be honest.

Chill atmosphere, food is moderately priced and they give you good portions.  The ONION RINGS ARE DELISH!!! What a pleasant surprise.  I was happy with the greek salad as well.. want to come for a beer and some onions rings after work sometime instead of just for lunch.

Probably not worth driving all the way down Battery to go to this place, but PERFECT for the work area since it's skimp on choices.. :)

Convenient outdoor seating even though the indoors is a fun atmosphere. I'm a fan indeed! :)
author: Melody T.

description: so far, my favorite burger in san Francisco. Burger was fresh and tasted juicy. Definitely recommend getting the fried egg on the burger. The potato skins were good. The bartenders were awesome. Extremely friendly and showing great customer service. Was the first time there and will definitely be going back for my constant burger needs
author: Steven K.

description:
I'm slowly beginning to infiltrate my circle of friends: they're starting to use Yelp more and more and discovering just how awesome it is.

Case in point: Happy Hour suggestions around Financial District/the Embarcadero brought up Grumpy's.  I never even knew this place existed, and I would've easily passed it over since it's really nonchalant and the entryway is small and it sits in the middle of warehouses and office buildings on Vallejo.  Parking there after 6 PM is super easy, and the place wasn't busy at all.

Chicken strips and fries were delish (as opposed to the T.I. Bar & Grill, ew), and even though I'm not a beer fan, theirs didn't make me gag as much as it usually does.  Really super chill, laid-back place (although the other groups in there at the time were REALLY loud so it was kind of hard to have a conversation).  Overall an excellent place to rewind after work.  Too bad it's not closer to the main part of the Financial District - but then again, maybe it's good that it's NOT closer because then it'd be WAY packed and I'd be sad because I'd have to wait for my food.
author: Tori S.

description: I'm the type of guy that thinks the quality of service is just as important as the quality/taste of the food. I came in for lunch today with my buddy and the place was packed. And for is busy as it was i didn't expect the service to be so good. A+ for service!! I had the cheeseburger and the garlic fries. Fries were good but a bit on the soggy side.  As for the burger, it was a good burger...nothing great but good. I was checking out other customers plates and they looked pretty tasty. I'll go for something different next time.
author: David S.

description:
I came to Grumpy's with some of my coworkers for a welcome lunch and had a great time! This was the first time I had ever been there.

Grumpy's is a casual spot for lunch to grab some beers and burgers. It's great for groups, even though the place is small, and it seemed like it was a popular place with tons of regulars.

After looking at the menu, we pretty much all ordered burgers and fries. From a basic cheeseburger to one of their specialty burgers, everyone was very happy with the food. I ordered a regular cheeseburger and it was cooked to my liking and it was pretty tasty. The fries were good but I wish they gave you more! 

Service was great - our server was very attentive and always made sure our glasses were refilled. Food came out in a timely manner and they really do their best to get food and drinks out since it is busy and on the smaller side.

I'd definitely recommend Grumpy's for lunch, just get there earlier so that you won't have to wait. It also seems like a good spot to catch a game or go to HH!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Yes. You should go. Order the following... don't even look at the rest of the menu. Turkey Burger is the best I have ever had... so much flavor.  And I love cows, I mean I avoid turkey burgers on general principle but wow... order it.  And get it Baja style... and of course for beer... i love a good beer menu too... of course a Hefeweizen for Jessica :-)

It's a small place so you might have to share a table or at the very least sit close enough to make new friends.  There are a few tables outside though.  Love it! Go!
author: Jessica S.

description: Delicious food.  Slightly pricey (I'm super cheap), but I'll come back again!
author: C U.

description: Loved this place. Small bar with a great craft beer selection.  Spoke to Kevin (I think he was the owner), who was tending bar.  Very cool dude that is one reason I'd go back to SF for another vacation. Place has great atmosphere.  Mostly locals were there.  I could have stayed for hours.....it's that kind of place.
author: Marc C.

description:
Was disappointed to learn that the prices and specials advertised on their website are very outdated (writing this review a month later so they had time to update it - hasn't happened yet). No more $4 drafts/margaritas at happy hour... how about $8 for a can of PBR and a shot? To be fair, those prices seemed a little too good to be true for this area.

Food-wise, the burgers were amazing, but the garlic fries were icky. Wet and creamy instead of crisp and aromatic. 

Overall, if you're looking for an affordable dive, I don't think this place qualifies. But if you are in the mood for a tasty burger, definitely check it out.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Food- not bad. Location- close to work. Service-- terrible. 

If you're on a 1-hr lunch, this is NOT the place for you! 

I've been here lots of times because its close to my office, but today was the last time.  If you're not spending 20 minutes waiting for a seat, you're waiting 20 mintues for someone to take your order... now that lunch is half way over, its gonna be another 15-20 for your food to come out. 

Yikes. At least if the average-at best food, added great service to a $30+ lunch for 2 bill, i might consider my return. :(
author: Cynsf Z.

description:
The two guys sitting at the bar next to me have been coming to Grumpy's for years, and were quick to offer tips on good apps there: skins and onion rings. However, I was there solely to try the bacon cheeseburger. Fortunately, they acknowledged the burger section as the best part of Grumpy's menu. Keep in mind that we're talking pub food; fanciness isn't expected, but rather good quality for a good price. 

You can't help but like a bar full of local media/advertising people who want to talk about anything but work. Personal pinions spill out after being sewn in by a long day of objective or targeted speech. Grumpy's is a straightforward local pub that will continue to be popular for years. And while my fun experience there made me want to like the burger a lot, I can't say it's one of my favorites from this burger quest over the past nine months.

The sesame bun was average and the patty itself was cooked medium rare, not medium as ordered. That's ok, because the bacon was present in every bite, and the juice from the patty and toppings filtered down to my fries, just as I'd hoped. The fries themselves were decent, roughly on par the burger. 

Overall, Grumpy's should never disappoint, especially if you get a burger there. Go there for a beer and stay for a couple more. Order one of their specialty burgers if you're looking to be wowed, and consider the sauteed mushrooms, which seemed to be a popular topping.
author: Mike H.

description:
Why art thou open for breakfast?  
Hash from a can, day old ice tea, menu says potatoes but they didn't come. Sourdough toast became wonder bread. Found old macaroni on my eggs. Weird.
So again..... why art thy open for breakfast?
author: Mark B.

description:
I work next-door to this place and love coming here with coworkers and friends on occasion.

Great drinks, great food, great staff. I rate things relative to my expectations and this place exceeds my expectations in terms of food quality and other things overall, so I give Grumpy's a 5/5.
author: Misha N.

description:
Went here weekly on Wednesdays after work to grab a beer and their $1 garlic fries!!!!!!!!!! I was three months from turning 21 but they never checked my id. Maybe I looked older with the people I was with.

It's a bit small but it sufficed. I noticed the people who came in were like me: just getting off of work and needed to relax with some booze. All the times I've been here, they always had a cute bartender that I stared at. haha. The last day I came in here, I was pretty drunk I wanted to get it off my chest so I told him he was cute. haha he thanked me and walked away. 

ANYWAYS, this place has affordable appetizers and beers. It was my first bar too!
author: Linda N.

description: Great little place near the Exploratorium!  My wife and I enjoyed a bit of a early afternoon happy hour with the kids to take a break from all of the great science exhibits.  Good food, good beer, and great energy!
author: David B.

description: Was in San Francisco with my sister for lunch. She couldn't find restaurant she had searched and we were using yelp for fish and chips close by.  Best fish and chips and macaroni and cheese I've tasted in awhile.  Best ginger ale too.  It was unusually hot in the city and it was nice to be in the cool pub.  Our server , Monica was so good as I like to try new places and ask lots of questions while I place my order.  I had leftovers for my long train ride home    Bonus is their bulldog mascot that looks like my Bentley 's Grandpa
author: Susie J.

description:
This is a small local American Pub with friendly staff members, great food and a full bar.  There is seating available outside, and heat lamps when cold.  When you first walk it, especially during lunch (11:30-1:30) it can get pretty loud and crowded.  Especially during a SF Giants day game.  Those days, I would just call in my order which will take 10-15 minutes.  Which really means 20-25 minutes. LOL. 

I come here for lunch, lunch meetings, etc.. because its across the street from where I work.  I recommend trying their fish n chips.  It never seems to fail my hunger.   You also have the option to cook your burger meat to order, I like it medium rare, bacon cheese burger is good.  Also, they have a good menu for breakfast as well, in this case I suggest ordering the corn beef hash with egg.  YUM! I am curious how their happy hour is because the pricing seems fair.  This is probably the place to be in this area during St. Patrick's day or during our local SF Giants Game Day. 

This is always a convenient stop for me during a busy work day.
author: Becky U.

description:
This is a great place right near my office.  Looking for a good Happy Hour spot, this is perfect.  Specials on Tecate tall boys and the food is decent for a bar.  I'd not make this a destination, but the quality for convenience is worth the four stars.  

I also dig that there's outdoor seating.  It's usually too cold, but if you want a smoke with your drink, it's pretty ideal!
author: Andy S.

description: Really decent bar food in a dive-y, but not too dive-y, bar filled with locals.  Kevin the bartender is super adorable!
author: Monica R.

description: Came here with my co-workers for work and it was packed at 1pm on a Friday afternoon. We thought we would beat the crowd but every table was filled. Almost everyone ordered the Super burger in my party and it looked amazing with the egg on top! I actually ordered the chicken curry salad sandwich because I was trying to be good with eating healthy but failed since I ordered onion rings. The sandwich was amazing but I'm giving this place only three stars because the service isn't awesome and it will always be crowded. I'll come here during their non busy hours for sure though.
author: Linda L.

description:
My friend(s) and I usually do a liquid lunch once a week or so and we decided to try Grumpy's Pub today.  It was a little bit of a trek but well worth it.  Our standard is basically the Royal Exchange which is pretty good with a solid beer selection and decent food.  In my mind RE is three stars, which is average, so my review will be in comparison to that.

The beer selection at Grumpy's was not as expansive as RE's but they definitely had a good selection (Anchor, Lagunitas IPA, Dos Equis, Hef, etc.) so for me Grumpy's held par.  The place is much smaller and had quite the lunch rush, but we still were able to walk right in at 1 pm on Friday and get seated. Our order was taken promptly enoug and our beers came out ahead of our meal.

I got a burger, medium rare, and my friend got a "Manhattan" which was kind of like a club sandwich.  He reported that it was good. My burger was also very good. Perfectly sized in that I could have eaten more but didn't need to.  The cheese was quality aged chedder and the bacon was perfectly cooked.  The fries were also good (I would have wanted more on the plate, but didn't NEED more).  The burger and sandwich were about $10/each.  Beers were $5/pint.

I was able to get my meal, two beers and out in about an hour which is the perfect time.  The place is kind of loud but it was busy and not to the point we were annoyed.

Grumpy's is a little out of the way, but worth the walk on a nice day. It's about 10 minutes from the Financial District.  If I was in between RE and Grumpy's, I would probably choose Grumpy's 80% of the time. Definitely worth a stop as they have many other choices on the menu, all of which looked good.
author: Hanley B.

description: Love this place!  You have to check it out yourself.  Burgers are delicious.  Bartenders are friendly.
author: Aleks P.

description:
This is a bar.  A bar with food.  No frills.  Working just around the corner...you can say that I've been here quite a bit.  They have a full bar and the usual suspects for beers on tap.  Their food is above average for a bar.  

If you're going for lunch, beware that on Friday's it will be packed and it may take awhile.  They do claim they serve breakfast, but I showed up at 9ish and their kitchen wasn't open yet, so it may be hit or miss.  

I've only gone to this place during the weekdays, with everything around it being offices, not sure what the scene is like during weekends.
author: Kevin T.

description:
I've been working two blocks away for almost a year and only today did I try Grumpy's. What the hell have I been doing all this time?

I had lunch here with a coworker at around 12:45 on Tuesday and it was pretty busy. There are quite a few tables for a small place and a few tables outside. The street is pretty quiet, but noisy enough to enjoy the bustle of outdoor seating. 

They serve the typical pub grub bites, but they focus on burgers. They probably have over ten combinations to choose from and give you the option of beef, turkey, or veggie patty. I ordered the Cafe Style Burger with avocado and sprouts with a side salad. I was surprised to see they served a legit side salad with carrots, tomatoes, cucumber, kidney beans, garbanzo beans, black olives, and wait for it...a slice of hard boiled egg. That side salad could have been a meal on its own. Other than salad, you could choose fries, onion rings, or if you're like the lady who sat next to me, mozzarella sticks with your sandwich. All of this food for under $10. It's a pretty good deal. The ingredients could have been a bit fresher, but other than that, no complaints. 

They also have a really decent selection of draft beers. No Budweiser or Coors Light here, at least not on tap. They serve Mirror Pond, Stella, Anchor Steam, Firestone, Dos Equis, Hefeweizen, and some others for only $5. They have Guinness and Boddington's for $6.
author: NickJess S.

description: DELICIOUS.  Oh man, this place is good.  I went with a friend of mine for lunch, and I ordered just the cheeseburger w/fries, and it was perfectly cooked, and very savory.  I also liked the vibe of this place during the work week -- a relaxing, yet upbeat place to grab a bite for lunch.  You can also see the Bay Bridge when you're walking in and the location is very convenient.  Dug it!
author: Mel G.

description: Bad Service. Came in with over a dozen people after a professional mixer & all bought food/drinks. We sat outside & noticed a few glass/plates left over from the previous group. Went inside to ask the bartender if he could have someone come out & buss the table, his response: "This is just a bar, move a few glasses over yourself." I was little dumbfounded by that response, most bars have employees who buss tables not customers who clean up after other customers. What's unfortunate is that he spoiled my experience there, the bartender who previously made me a drink was very friendly. I won't be returning or recommending this bar.
author: Lily R.

description: I like this quaint little pub! Perfect spot to grab a beer, drinks fries and fun! I like coming here with the co-workers to share great conversation. They have happy hour specials!
author: Marie P.

description: GRUMPY'S!!! This place is great! Best dive bar around for sure. They have good happy hours and considering it's a darker, noisy dive bar, it's clean, the staff is friendly and they have a huge selection of food - and it's really good at that! It's one of our favorite lunchtime spots and we'll definitely be back.
author: Sheena C.

description: Love Grumpys! It's my go to place after work. The bartenders are great, they make you feel right at home. Foods great, you can hang out in the street & drink beer while chatting with the locals. I highly recommend it!
author: Shawn B.

description:
If I had to choose a last meal, it would have to be a hamburger.  Interesting way to start off the review, I know, because now it's probably automatically assumed I have named Grumpy's as my favorite hamburger of all time...anyone reading my reviews must know I love hamburgers...

Well they do make a great burger.  I never go crazy with the specialty burgers here.  I've been about 4 times or so.  I just love the basic cheeseburger and having a beer.  It's just solid.  It's a fun little pub near the Embarcadero with a cool staff, atmosphere and a solid burger.  Not sure I can drag the review out much more than that.

So is it my favorite burger of all time forever and ever? I know everyone is wondering. K, good talk.
author: John R.

description:
So, one of my business partners and I landed a contract that was about two blocks from this joint and remarkably, there just isn't that many "go-to's" for lunch in that area (Green Street and Embarcadero) The Ferry Building got old, Piperade was just a bit too "la-dee-da" for a quick lunch. Between this, Old Ship and RJ's Market (which is pretty good) we found ourselves polarized by the convenience of Grumpys. So that said, my ramble below pertains only to lunch experiences.

So, once you get your head and belly into a "sandwiches, burgers and salads" type of mindset, the place delivers. To date, I've stayed on the middle-of-the-road path with the menu (classic cheeseburgers with fries or a side salad, grilled chix sandwiches, tuna melts,  cobb salads, beet salads, etc.) and ALL of that grub was prepped and served up really well. Proteins were fired to perfection at the right temps, fries were crisp and soft on the inside with great seasoning, salads were big and put together with a mix of toppings and textures to make even something so basic, still delish. You actually catch yourself thinking, "wow, the food here is pretty damn good."

AND...mind you, I haven't even tried any of the Signature Burgers (15+ gourmet burger types from the Baja to the Popeye), the chicken parm, the turkey plate, other fancier salads or any of the bar-food apps. SO, I can only imagine this place gets better and better. The bartender was talking me into the chili-cheese fries, which are supposed to be damned good, but I was already two beers down and needed to head out for a meeting.

Which brings me to booze, staff and ambiance. Booze: great beers on tap and affordable hard liquor bevvies and happy hour specials. Great place for liquid lunches - ding ding ding.  Staff: Welcoming and friendly, just as we all like. In the mad rush, they can get a bit busy so sometimes it can feel a little slow (in the kitchen or front of house) but they keep up for the most part and do it with coolness, kindness and smiles. Ambiance: Hell, it's a pub/barfood joint. If you're looking for tablecloths and a sommelier then you might keep on steppin'. BUT, if a pile of kegs in the corner, a bunch of tables crammed edge to edge, Sportscenter on on the TVs, Foo Fighters (yes Dave Grohl gets loud when they come on in there for some reason) rockin' in the background and great food at a great price...go get you some Grumpys. 

And, if you figure out what the hell the bulldog with the fern leaf logo is all about, you win free Grumpys for life. Just kidding. I just want to know what the backstory is on that. 

Cheers.
author: Kyle T.

description:
This place is small and gets packed quick. Good happy hour. We were there on a Friday and can't beat the $3 Tecates. 

I have been here for burgers and fries and it sooooo delicious. 

Looking forward to another happy hour here, although I will have to arrive early to get a good seat.
author: Lauren W.

description:
The burger was bang'n and the fries were perfectly greased, salted, and crisped.  I would totally give this place 5 stars if they would just speed it up a bit.  

$5 IPA not bad for the neighborhood - I'd go back!
When a large group arrives after me and a friend, and then we get served after the group, it bothers me =(.  Other than the long wait (to eat, not sit or have our order taken), I have no complaints.
author: Rayna A.

description:
Best bar and grill in the Financial District for sure. The tuna melt is delicious. So are the onion rings. If you want a healthier side, the salad is also really good...they use fresh ingredients and spice it up with garbanzo beans. They always give me extra pickles...I don't even have to ask! It's like the waitresses read my mind or something!
Anyway, the service is great, too. Even if it's super crowded, you can get in and out within an hour. I still haven't made it over there for happy hour, only because it's a bit of a hike from BART, but look forward to trying it soon!
author: Jenny R.

description:
Grumpy's serves as the meeting place for the non-suited maritime industry at my work.  Usually after a Board meeting, much like agendized issues, there will be a split between the pilots and industry; the industry head to table-clothed diners such as Tadich Grill and Piperade while the pilots head to Grumpy's.  Coming here, I now know why.

Placing the batsignal to prison fodder Hueyn/Mindy, we arrived to a packed bar.  Grumpy's is a very small area and on the initial scan, this place reminded me of the mythical Tortuga.  At the bar, you see full-blossomed strumpets laughing at every joke of their consorts, vying for attention and hopefully, another drink, slyly letting their robust chest touch said man's arm from time to time.  Ahhh..the power of female wiles.  Basically, for you Davis alumni, this is Cantinas del Cabo in the daytime.
