The manager was very gracious despite the crowd and rush of orders, ushered us to our table in a timely fashion.  I ordered the Baja burger while Mindy ordered the Western burger.  Our waitress was brisk and curt, understandable with the lack of manpower here, and could not engage in banter.  My gripe with this place is that the food took forever which seems to be a reoccurring theme among it's clients.  The problem with this is two fold:
1.  one gets extremely hungry
2.  most importantly, if your company is with somebody similar to Huyen/Mindy and his stories of getting turned out in prison become trite and downright sick, the conversation becomes rather stale and there is only so many people you can text or pretend to check time.  jk jk

The burgers finally came out and by that time, I was too famished to really enjoy the burger.  This burger, similar to the Old Ship, is more of a bar burger.  There is nothing gourmet about it.  It drips grease and the bun becomes soaked quickly.  I prefer my buns toasted. The patty was large but devoid of any robust flavour.  I found the picca de gallo to be underwhelming...the salsa wasn't distinct.  There was a minimal amount of seasoning...again..this is just your salt and peppered'd hamburger patty.  This is not your 7x7 Top Burgers that cost $15-20.  The fries were your traditional American salted fries..soggy but with ketchup and ranch, the perfect complement to a meal.  The bacon was thick and bountiful and the bottom line was that it was food for the soul, good to coat the lining of your stomach for an impending le twist adventure.  You will come to Grumpy's leaving without its namesake emotion.  The burgers are old fashioned and simple and takes me to a childhood when I did not know of finer things in life such as brie, fried egg, goat cheese condiments.  Sometimes it is better that one does not know.  They also have a $7 special during happy hour consisting of a shot of jamison and a brewski.  Drinks to the most delectable cutlet at the bar...wadDUUP.
author: Brian V.

description:
Grumpy's is overrated in terms of the food. But a great place for drinks with friends and to let loose.

A group of 8 from the office went to try this place on recommendation of a very outspoken female co-worker. We sat inside, occupying 2 tables. We ordered 6 different burgers + one chicken, and one sandwich suggested by the waiter (I think it was ham & cheese, but I don't remember) for one of the girls (all ~$8, w/choice of: fries, potato or green salad). It took a while to get our order, after several rounds of beers & sodas.

To make the story short, I'm the only one who finished my burger (I was hoongry!!). Everyone in the group agreed that it wasn't very good. They gave me a weird look because my plate was clean - and I had to keep explaining that I was hungry. The co-worker lost all credibility on choosing our next lunch spot, but her knowledge about places in which to get drunk remains unmatched (she knows the bartenders by name).

Tip for inexperienced office workers (thought it was needed, after reading some reviews): Whenever we go to lunch in a group we pool our cash together to pay the bill and tip, or one person picks up the tab and we divide it later. We don't ask for separate bills in crowded and busy places like this one. Hope this helps!
author: Luis C.

description:
My fiance and I stumbled on Grumpy's when we were visiting the city last week. We read the yelp reviews and were very excited to try their burgers. Let me tell you, they did not disappoint! The burgers were well cooked and the ingredients were fresh. I got the salad with my burger and this was no iceburg lettuce and ranch. The salad was packed full of yummy things including eggs, kidney beans and cucumbers!

The burgers were good and the beer was cold... Stop in and try it!
author: Brandi C.

description: Grumpy's is an awesome lil bar with good drinks and delicious food. I'll often come here on my lunch break or right after work, and while they aren't open on weekends (sadness) they make me happy. Prices are fair, considering how great the food is. I usually get a cheeseburger because it's damn good.
author: Holly M.

description:
How can you not love a classic Barbary Coast style pub?  Ok, so you're not going to be robbed or get into a fight at lunchtime, but there is still a trap-door in the floor where you can imagine old drunkards being drugged and sent off to sea for an involuntary trip to Shanghai.  Sadly I think they now use the trapdoor for transporting veggie burgers.  If only the Sidney Ducks knew what became of their stomping grounds...

Honestly I have nothing unique to contribute about this place that hasn't already been written: I just wanted my name to appear next to the Grumpy moniker.  That and to profess my love for my Friday lunch haunt, which satisfies a fix for what I think is the best turkey burger in the city.  

The burger's come in a multitude of options, but almost always I go with the "Popeye" which features spinach and feta - I am'z what I am'z cause I eats my spinach.  The fries are perfect (but they don't travel well so dine-in).  If you don't want fries you can go the side-salad route, knowing that Grumpy's serves up a far better side-salad than you deserve to get in a bar.  Seriously, who goes to a pub for a salad?  

Everything I've had at Grumpy's rates well.  Salads too.  I have a friend who is eating his way down the menu and it never ceases to surprise us how each offering is seemingly better than expected.  Grumpy's is just very good.  It is also busy and loud.  There is some outside seating but I'm always cold so that's not the best option if your cold-blooded too.

Go, have a pint, have some fries and try not to end up on a ship out to sea.  Although I hear Shanghai is lovely this time of year.

Check out the menu at: http://grumpys.citysearch.com/
author: Aaron M.

description: Aside from always being able to count on Grumpy's for a quality burger, this place has got to go down (along with Old Ship Saloon a few blocks away) in the books and its role in the history of San Francisco's budding advertising industry. Evidenced by placards like publicis and cutwater that are part of its decor, this restaurant is tucked away between the embarcadero and financial district and is always a good place for a solid burger for lunch and a cold frosted beer after work (or lunch!)
author: wendy q.

description:
Their Super Burger might be the best burger I've ever had in a restaurant.

I asked for it medium rare, and it was a perfect pink all throughout.  Topped with delicous bacon and a fried egg (along with all the expected fixins), this was one of those lunches that had me grinning from the first bite until the last.
author: Dave H.

description:
It's been a great day.  It's been a shitty day.  It doesn't matter, if is a day that requires a scrumptious, delicious, salivating burger with tasty onion rings and a cold beer....this is the place to hit.

Based in the 'ad ghetto' of the city, this pub is an animal to deal with on a Friday evening as all the local ad agencies flock here.  But if you can elbow your way to the bar and belly up, you're in for a treat.

If you have read my reviews, I love places that are simple, have attentive staff, genuine + low-key patrons  and well cooked food.  I got the baja burger on this particular trip, but I'll be back to destroy each and every burger on their list.  See you there.
author: Keith J.

description: Local pub local to my office near Levis Plaza on Battery.  Great location, quiet street setting. They have very good service, even when it's packed, great burgers, a wide selection of beers and just all around fun place to hang during lunch or after work.
author: Patrick W.

description:
This place is near my work so I come here a lot of happy hour. I come here usually for the $5 draft beer and $1 garlic fries...$1 GARLIC FRIES! really good, but super greasy! 

it says you have to spend over $20 to pay with card, but the bartender doesn't care so you can use your card for a lesser amount.
author: Dorris W.

description: Delicious burgers. Thick patties and fresh toppings. The onion rings and garlic fries are yummy. No dedicated gluten free menu but they will take extra care for allergy concerns. No dedicated kids menus but the little gave his burger two thumbs up.
author: Beth K.

description: This is the best pub ever... I love the bartender guy that works there, he's super cool and super nice.  Most bar tenders are usually rude when it's busy, not here!  I love their fries with bacon, egg and cheese on top!
author: Naps V.

description:
I've walked past this pub a number of times on my way to the new Exploratorium. I happened to be hungry this past week and decided to stop by to grab a burger. The other reviews do not lie. The burger with a fried egg and bacon was one of the tastiest burgers I've ever had. I asked for medium rare, and it came out exactly as ordered. The beef patty was seasoned perfectly as well, you can still taste the meat. I have plans to come back to try their other Signature burgers at $12 a burger. 

Side note, the fries it came with were also very crispy. I opted for the garlic fries, and they definitely have a kick.
author: Rich G.

description: Walked by a bunch of times so had to give it a try. Packed at lunch time, close enough from the fin district to make the walk. Burger was good, not amazing... Same with the fried chicken. Beers on tap rock, loved the boddingtons-like red hen. What makes the place special is the cool bar atmosphere, loaded with people, fun hang out, good for afternoon sports.
author: Andrew S.

description: I came here last week for a quick bite to eat and loved it! The food is delicious and the bartender we had was very polite. Would definitely come here again! Also love the small cuteness of the place!
author: Jessica B.

description: Great food for a pub.  Loved the beer selection.  Service was good.  I got the Philly.  Only odd point was that the seem not to give many fries, but the portion was great anyway.
author: Robert M.

description: Media, Agency, Digital worlds collide with drinks and food. They close early on weekdays but have beer + shot specials.
author: Ryan K.

description:
You can definitely come here and get something a bit on the lighter side. I had the 'summer salad' - with mango, avocado, feta, chicken, onions and garbanzos. Sooo delish. 

On top of that, a great crowd to experience the World Cup game with!
author: Jen N.

description:
Great food, great atmosphere, great staff.

The people who run Grumpy's are smart. They picked a prime location in-between two large television stations in San Francisco -- they know the secret of the TV people...we like to eat good food.

This place definitely has good food. Great food, in fact. A relaxed, comfortable atmosphere meshes with a cheerful and friendly staff.

They get busy around lunchtime, but you can always call in your order to go. Great stop for a drink after work.

Try the burgers once, then come back and try any dish that comes with mac and cheese. Yum.
author: Matthew K.

description:
Alright. It's not just the beer.

But their food is excellent!

Cafe Sprout Turkey Burger (for only about $10) = the best turkey burger I've ever had!!! Topped with sprouts, avocado, and monterey jack cheese. It comes with a side of fries, potato salad, or mixed greens. Even the side salad is great! -- Fresh greens topped with garbanzo beans, kidney beans, and olives (the balsalmic dressing is great!)

I don't know where they source their burger meats from...but man is it juicy!

And those $1 garlic fries during Happy Hour (Tuesdays) are delicious!

Great food at a great price + friendly, smiley service + large selection of beers = 5 stars. 

So happy this place is just a block from work!
author: Gail N.

description:
Grumpy's has absolutely everything you could ask for in an after-work watering hole: good food (their new addition of buffalo chicken strips was a stellar idea), happy hour specials, televisions playing sports, weirdo employees from Second Life, the occasional hot cougar, and a friendly bar staff that will remember you if you're there enough.

The relative lack of traffic on Vallejo Street is nice because on crowded, sunny days the clientele can spill out into the street. The jalapeno poppers and the baja burger are highly recommended. 

Go there for lunch or go there for happy hour. Hell, you can even go there for breakfast because the bloody mary is pretty legit too.
author: Eric M.

description:
I'm a little upset knowing this business was partly responsible for keeping Off the Grid away from the area (Vallejo and Front). But I can understand why they'd do it.

However, I've come here a few times anyway. Once, I asked the bartender for some drink... let's say it was a Lagunitas. He didn't have it or there was some problem with the carbonation. So I asked for a... let's say Racer 5. There's no way I can remember exactly what beer I asked for. Same problem.

So he gave me a free beer. And for that reason, I will forever be loyal to Grumpy's. Thank you, cool bartender. You were also very fast and hard-working, virtues I admire.
author: adrian b.

description:
Dear Cook at Grumpy's:
Screw you for doing such a piss poor job of making my garlic fries.
author: jack p.

description:
Food: Happy Hour Garlic Fries $1.00, zucchini sticks with fries and a bacon burger with potato salad (the bartender asked me if I wanted fries with that, hope he was joking...)

Drinks: Happy Hour $7.00 beer and a shot.

Food and drinks get a solid 4 stars, service gets 3, bathroom gets 3, awesome name and non douchey crowd gets 5 stars.
author: Poppy C.

description:
If you can handle the cacaphony of noise that's continually at maximum volume when the place is full, this is an awesome place to go with a friend or two.  I've been here twice strictly for the food (I don't drink) - both in the early evening during the week.  The first time I had a killer burger, the last time it was a chili dog.  

Now neither of those is very healthy for someone who is really needing to eat only health-type foods.  Yet Every once in a while I just want to chow down, and both times, Grumpy's has hit a home run on that count.  Simply extraordinary food.  

Now if there were just a way to get the volume down 6 notches from all the people talking...
author: Alan B.

description: Date night, hubby and I went here for dinner and drinks before the Exploratorium. We wanted something within walking distance, but away from the tourist. This place was perfect. Great atmosphere. Good food. Bartenders were the best!!!
author: Lisa E.

description:
lunch with co workers after watching d Giants parade. the crowd hasn't arrived so we got good seats.
 we ordered burgers and drinks. 
I got mushroom Brie burger with fries= good. burger was cooked perfect.
 
service... slow. d servers and the kitchen were backed up with pick up orders that they kept  their seated customer waiting for at least 30 mins.
I think a good restaurant management should plan to make sure that this doesn't happen.
author: Learnee L.

description:
I can't believe I haven't written a review about the best after work bar in the city (or at least in Multi-media gulch).

Grumpy's is a great place to wind down after work during happy hour. They have HH specials all week. It's also a great place to eat. From their appetizers to their burgers and salads, their food is delicious. Just note, that you cannot get a salad after about 5:00 pm. But why would you when their burgers and fries are amazing. I've heard their turkey burger is one of the best in town. I have never eaten it myself, but I trust the folks I've heard this from.

Drinks are their specialty. But not in terms of fru-fru drinks like Mojitos, but real drinks like Vodka & Soda, Jack and Coke, etc. From Monday - Wednesday (I think), you can get a shot and a draft for $7. They have a list of liquors that you can get for the shot.

Friday's special is usually 24 oz Tecate beers for something like $3! That's just plain crazy!

But the most amazing this is they just started carrying Miller High Life! The Champagne of Beers! 

If you work (or live) in the neighborhood, you should wander over to Grumpy's for a drink or two. The place is nice, the bartenders are great and the regulars are a colorful bunch. Sit at the bar and an interesting conversation is minutes away.

Cheers!
author: Kenny W.

description:
Ugh. So torn. 

Service: 1 star
Food: 4 stars

What's a gal to do? Honestly, I don't think I've ever come here where there wasn't an absurd situation with the service. Like, forgetting to put bacon on my bacon cheeseburger. Or not bringing out the second round of beers we all ordered. Or forgetting my side of ranch (EVERY time!) Or just not coming to take our order...period.

But......the burgers! Ah, they can put a smile on anyone's face. Even the faces of those who have been snubbed by rude servers who claim you can't split a bill 2 ways.

So fine, 4 stars. 

Tip: Get the turkey burger Baja style (comes with avocado, cheese, bacon, and salsa). For some reason I prefer the turkey burger here!
author: Hannah L.

description: The food is good, but like their name foreshadows, the employees are majorly grumpy. This was some of the worst service I've received, from the waitress throwing down napkins and utensils on our table to her unprofessional behavior during the payment process (Oh, wait, you guys paid $100? *Removes some of the change she gave to us).
author: Melody L.

description:
Excellent beer selection in bottles and draft.  Burgers are very good.  

Went for the first time with a small group from work (there were five of us).  We got here at about 5:45 and most tables were available but the bar was full - if the weather had not been decent I think people at tables outside would have been in and the seating woukd have been tighter.  Within half an hour the place was PACKED.  

You need to know how to operate.  Grab a table first, decide what you want, go to the bar and order your food and drink.  Carry your drinks to the table yourself and repeat as necessary until you are ready to close out then go to the bar to pay.  They bring the food to you and will fetch and carry condiments, et cetera.  

One of our number wanted salad and the menu shows several.  Salad was not to be had.  We did not investigate whether this was a normal circumstance or a fluke but I would not get a salad here, the burger was just too good.

Everyone liked what they had.  All burgersnwere ordered medium and they came out exactly right, not too bloody and not too much grease dripping on the plate.  

We had a regular burger, a russian burger, a cheeseburger, another burger that came with avocado, and a grilled cheese sandwich.  Fries were good, thicker cut (not steak fries but not skinny fries that are so popular).  The American eatwr among us was very please that American cheese was available for the grilled cheese.

Next time we are wondering where to go for a divey experience but not completely gross, we'll come here.
author: Rachel E.

description:
My memory is better than I thought. I went to Grumpy's for the first time a few years back and remembered it as having a good burger. But this was before yelp, so I never had any place to record those thoughts for the world to see (and for me to use as a reference point years down the road). So I wasn't sure.

After returning for a second time, I can yelp with complete confidence it is indeed a great spot. Plenty of beef-turkey-chicken options, super friendly/quick service, and fries or a salad on the side. My turkey burger was delicious, no wheat bun, but I appreciated being offered wheat toast instead (yes!), and the side salad was bigger than expected. Everything felt very reasonable for $9.

Only the lack of a distinctive bonus - house veggie burger, grilled onions, etc - prevents a clean sweep of stars. But it's a solid four, and one of the better financial district burger spots.
author: Jason B.

description:
I try...REALLY hard not to make fun of other people's reviews...OK I don't try hard...actually I don't try at all...but I don't think I've read a bigger collection of wussbag reviews than for this place.

First of all, to the people who think prices here are expensive need to loosen up a bit on their money purses.  It's in San Francisco; you go to a place that hugs the North Beach - Financial district border, what do you expect?  Seriously, you frugal fairies, bony bastards, parsimonious pieces of shit...how many items do you see here over $10

Second of all, waiters wait and bartender are bartend.  Do I see Dr. Phil or Silvia Browne in here? No!  They can't read your mind nor predict your thinking and thank God, cuz no one really wants to know what the hell goes on inside that stupid little head of yours.  If you received the wrong order or if your order took longer, ASK (politely) and they - like any good barstaff - will get it right.  It's OK to ask the bartender how much longer your food will take or send your food back for the right order.  They thrive on word of mouth and much rather you leave happy than you leave unsatisfied...DUH...Stop sitting there pissed off and arguing with the world with your eyes and posture, no one likes that shit you wuss.  

My friend and I came here on a Wednesday night and imbibed in that night's specials - $7 shot and beer, $1 garlic fries...oh garsh, almost broke my piggy bank!!  We got fish and chips and a burger.  The large portions helped pad the stomach for the beers we ordered.  The bartender was overworked - he ran the bar and restaurant orders by himself and didn't shower us with attention - boohoo.  Each step of the way I needed to ask for attention - "I'd like to order drinks please," "Can we order food?" "We'll take the check now"...how difficult was that??!?!?  He was nice about it, told some jokes, interacted with us and harassed us to come back and visit.  The bill?  A mind blowing $24...

An interesting mix of crowd (at least when we went) - financial district people, loud bridge and tunnel dudes, a softball team and a group of three chicks that could make Stevie Wonder cry.  It's a homey place - felt (and looked) a bit like Paddy's Pub from It's Always Sunny In Philadelphia.  I like the vibe here, I definitely felt at ease here and would come back for happy hour.  Signs on the walls, dollar bills pinned to the ceiling and funny lookin' chicks create a homey vibe with a tinge of amusement.  The Jaeger keg however, reminds you it's still a legit drinking establishment.
author: Nico M.

description:
Grumpy's is a kick-ass hole in the wall sorta pub.  They've got about 6-8 beers on tap and a nice selection of liquor.  The burgers and fries are solid drunk bar food and go well with a pint or 12- just keep in mind, it's a pub, not whatever gourmet place some people seem to exclusively eat at.  They have booze, the prices are reasonable, happy hours are entertaining (Thursday $4 margaritas, M-W is beer and a shot, F is $3 tall boy tecates) and the bartenders are superfriendly.  Well, at least they are to me because I have fun with them.  Sean, Mary and Kevin rule- mostly at destroying my liver with love.

There's usually a decent crowd in the mid-afternoon and it stays pretty busy until about 8 or 9, when most of the passersby head off to north beach since most everything else in the area shuts down by 10.  The crowd is mostly younger, but still an interesting mix of people.  It's almost undoubtedly the most laid-back, unassuming place to grab a drink.  

If you want a place to chill after a lame day at work, this is it.  All the Paddy's/Cheers references are spot-on.
author: matt s.

description: Great breakfast!!  Great service!!  The breakfast burrito was very tasty. Kids enjoyed the hamburger's and son enjoyed French toast. Reasonable prices also
author: Bart F.

description:
Not sure what that one Yelper was smoking, but this place is NOT a dive by any standard. The damn barstaff wear button down shirts and there is a lot of light, corporate logos on the (clean) walls, and a kitchen that serves more than just burgers.
Since we were in the area and it's the only bar we saw we popped in for a couple rounds, which were priced well and strong enough. The first bartender did not have a button down shirt and he was friendly and offered good advice on booze when they ran out of what we had the first round. I'd go back if I was over that way.
author: Colleen B.

description: Great burgers and friendly service. This was a good spot for lunch only a block away from the crowds on the Embarcadero.
author: Andy V.

description:
When I call in a lunch order of 5 burgers, 

and you tell me that they'll be ready in 20 minutes, 

and I arrive in 20 minutes, 

and you tell me that it'll just be 5 more minutes,

and the 5 minutes turns into 20 minutes,

and then you finally produce my order, 

and then when I get back to the office I discover that 3 of the burgers were made wrong --

-- don't expect more than 3 stars.
author: Curran H.

description:
This place is attached to my work is both really cool and sad at the same time.

Its really cool because this place is really good. The burgers are always juicy. Last time I was here I tried the Super. After seeing my friends enjoy their burgers with a fried egg on it at the New Zealander I decided to go with the Super at Grumpy's because it comes with a fried egg, cheddar cheese, and my favorite condiment...bacon.

The burger was perfectly cooked and juicy as usual. The egg added an extra richness to the burger...it has a soft yoke so it ran everywhere. The bacon added a crispy crunch and bacon flavor.

The fries are pretty good too. Crisp but not over cooked. 

The bartenders and wait staff have always been friendly and they do have some good beers on Tap, Anchor Steam yum.

The sad part is I don't get here enough.
author: Alex R.

description: Just started school close by and brought a large crew over because I heard Grumpy's was good, but it was closed when we arrived at 9pm on a Tuesday. Not even a sign up. Am I missing something?
author: Jessica L.

description: Ate here today with my co-worker, and was pleasantly surprised.  Sat down at the bar because I enjoy bar seating during lunch, and ordered up a couple of burgers. We actually both got the Super, and ordered it "medium". I've got to say, i was AMAZED with the the fact my burger came out medium! not medium well, not well, not burnt...MEDIUM! enjoyed it thuroughly, the bartender was quick on the soda refills wihtout even asking.  My only gripe would be that the garlic fries aren't worth the extra $1.50.  They weren't bad, but it was more of a garlic oil than minced garlic and I prefer the minced.
author: Michael B.

description:
Went there on Thursday night- awesome food.  Great service at the bar, and good beer selection

Dropped down the rating as they are only open Monday-Friday... if they were open on weekends, easily 5 stars
author: Rose H.

description: Had a great turkey burger here for lunch the other day.  Service was quick, especially since they were pretty busy due to the baseball game.  Anyway, I'll be back for the PBR and a shot of whiskey special.
author: John B.

description: I went for a turkey burger(I'm trying to eat healthier) and the bartender said they were good but their hamburgers were really good, so I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and onion rings. Really good burger, onion rings were ok. I went back on my next trip to the city and got the turkey  burger and garlic fries. Tasty and juicy burger, garlic fries really good also. They have a few good beers on tap, several bottled beer and a full bar. They close at 10, so not a late night bar. It is a great place for a burger and a few beers.
author: J K.

description: Surprisingly great burgers here. The burgers are huge and the fixings on them make it even more delicious. It'll definitely fill you up. The fries are ok, but I prefer the onion rings. It has the light batter that I like.
author: Jun W.

description:
Stopped in last night with a co-worker to grab a burger on our dinner break...the burgers were really tasty and cooked exactly as ordered.  Fries were hot and crispy (surprisingly a lot of restaurants can't get their fries this way!) and the staff extremely helpful and not grumpy at all.
I'll definitely be back, hopefully next time after work so I can sample some of the fine beers that they have on tap.
author: phil h.

description:
Don't be surprised if a Yardbird or even Paul McCartney himself saddles up next to you at the bar. Not only does Grumpy's serve up what I'm inclined to name the BEST BURGER IN SAN FRANCISCO, but it's also the closest I've come to finding the perfect English Pub. 

Its brick walls, Brit charm and sweet ass mascot (Grumpy the Bulldog) make this tucked away restaurant feel like your boggy home away from home. Wide selection of beer, wine and spirits - including Jager on tap. And as if the booze alone isn't enticing enough, their menu will find a place in your little limey heart. Burgers prepared a dozen ways (try the Western style veggie burger with bacon!), salads to cure your scurvy, and soups to warm your soul. 

Parking won't kill you (bring quarters!) and you're bound to see a few interesting characters eating solo at the bar. Don't forget to check out the ceiling... you never know what just might fall into your lap...
author: Katelin H.

description:
Finally made it here and it's Margarita night!  $4 for tall margaritas from 4pm till close!  Let me just say that they are generous on the tequila :)

So that's definitely a great start and hubby was happy with the many drafts available.  We got in slightly after 7pm and were still able to order food.  

Hubby got the Fat Tire and I got the margarita, after all, how can anyone turn down a $4 tall margarita?  One sip and my first reaction was "wow, they are generous on alcohol!" and hubby took a sip and agreed.  I think I'll be returning on Thursdays just for this.

Now food, I remember reading about their burger and one of the bartenders confirmed it.  Hubby got the mushroom brie burger with fries and I decided with the fried chicken with mashed potatoes w/ gravy and some veggies.  The burger was cooked to order, medium rare and the brie was a great combination.  The fries were perfectly crispy, great when hot but still good when it cooled down.  My fried chicken - there were 3 pieces - one each of the wing, thigh and breast.  It was very crispy but pretty tasty.  I only had the wing and thigh since I'm not a white meat person.  Hubby had it and said it was a bit dry.  However, the mashed potato was SO GOOD - it was lumpy so you can taste the real potato and the gravy was good.

The bartenders, Sean and Kevin, were both friendly.  Sean also made a spice pear martini for me - some special and it was tasty.  Again, generous on alcohol.  The regular patrons were very friendly.  We struck up a good conversation with a few and perhaps we'll run into them again.

A great neighborhood gem.  If there's a fault, it would be that they close early around 9pm...
author: Gloria H.

description:
Grumpy's is an interesting mix of an English pub, Fidi / Ad agency lunch spot.  The small, bustling little brick building delivers some tasty burgers, fried chicken, and generous portions of the greens (definitely a plus).  

Full bar, and plenty of beers to choose from, so don't be shy... treat yourself to some alcoholic refreshments.

Speaking of shy, you'll probably need to be aggressive about flagging someone to take your order.  And don't come here if you're in a rush either.

Love the name of this place too.
author: shaun l.

description:
Their burgers are soooo dammmnnn goooood!

Everytime, the burger patty is cooked perfectly.  It's never burnt, never too bloody, and always juicy.

The burger and fries portions are huge!  I only eat at this place when I know I can be in a food coma for the rest of the afternoon at work.

They do tend to take a little longer prepping your food.  I've done a few sit downs there, and it'll take a good 20 minutes for your burger to come out.  They do take phone orders, so I recommend that route if you're in a hurry.
author: Maggie L.

description:
Grumpy's is my version of Cheers. You won't find a better place to get a drink and pub food at after 10 hours of working in an ad agency where your co-workers back stab you, your clients put your work down, and it's been the day from hell.

The bartenders, Mary and Sean, treat you like family. And the strangers at the bar become fast friends. Come by for a drink sometime!
author: Michelle Y.

description:
Why would anyone name this bar Grumpy's?  Nothing grumpy about it!  Although a little dangerous on the Friday happy hour scene....that wouldn't make anyone 'grumpy' per se...

Cute little hideaway near work and best turkey burger I have ever tasted!
author: Yelper A.

description:
Fun place to meet up for a few cold ones after work on a weekday.  The food is almost all fried.  This is good, because if I start hitting the sauce at 6pm, I'm going to need something to soak it up. Like fried cheese.

If you have enough to drink here I suggest that you walk up the hill to crowbar for some really cheap drink and then cheap domestics at Showgirls.

When happy hour is 7 hours long... endless possibilities.
author: Thadd L.

description:
I might be making a mistake in getting my food to go from here. Even when i called ahead, showed up after they said it would be ready, i still waited. 
The point of take out is you don't have time to sit and eat.
Any how the burgers are decent, I like the brie mushroom, and they get points for many different flavors, toppings.
author: Tina A.

description:
Tasty burger and a decent beer selection (including one British ale, always a good sign as an ex-pat!).

One star knocked off for a soggy burger bun.
author: Rich N.

description: I've been to Grumpy's multiple times over the years and I enjoy it as it has good food, a good beer selection and it's kinda out in the middle of nowhere.  However, I went with my friend this past week and the service was really poor.  We got there relatively early and got our pick of where to sit since no one was there but we didn't get our meals until people that sat down next to us and arrived 20 minutes later than we did.  There was no apology or you know what we'll take care of your drinks.  And it wasn't like we ordered something difficult either.  So be careful next time you head to Grumpy's as you might have the same experience that I did.
author: Blake B.

description:
This place rocks....okay so I've only been once, but in that one time I ended up shot gunning beers with the bar tender, closing down the bar (after kicking a shaddy character out), and sticking around to play my first ever round of dice for horrible tequila shots (poor greg.....). 

This is one of my top ten favorite bars! Locals only, yet somehow they let me hang.
author: Kevin N.

description: Small spot with strong drinks!!  Indoor and outdoor seating (about 5 small tables inside), with a game always on.  They serve food to order as well.  Good place for a much needed strong drink after work.
author: Dee H.

description: Attended a private party with about 50 people. Booze was great. But the food? Hamburgers were OK, but Grumpy's put out about 10 at a time for 50 people? Then nothing. Then some fried chicken. Each platter lasted about 5 minutes or LESS. Then nothing was put out. Steamed vegetables? Some deal. Everything put out separately, then 15 minutes until the next thing. Fried chicken was OK if you don't mind ice cold in the center. This was precooked, then thrown into hot oil. Hot on the outside, but cold on the inside. One poor bartender had to work the whole room of 50 people, including serviing booze, putting out the little food they had, and clean up tables. One guy cooking in back. 2 of staff for the whole party of 50 people That's it. No bus boys, no waiters, no service. I'll bet they save a ton of money on labor and food supplies.
author: Jack B.

description: Working on telegraph-Hill you are pretty limited as to what you can do for lunch as everything takes super long. We decided to come to this place and we were greeted right as we walked in staff was very attentive. Food was great. i had the Baja Burger (which I personally recommend) with bacon Mac n Cheese (you won't be disappointed). I tried the snake bite beer. Very good combination if you are looking for something light. All in all I will definitely be back.
author: Jamie A.

description: When I worked near Levi Plaza, I always kicked off my weekend with happy hour at Grumpy's. Great prices - $3 Tecate was always a popular choice. Their food is excellent as well. Try the veggie burger, you won't be disappointed. Grumpy's can get pretty packed around 5, but it usually clears out by 7:30 or so.
author: Allison B.

description: Fair to say Grumpy's serves the best burger in the financial district.  No knock on Burger Bistro or Gotts-something - that fancy nancy place at the Ferry Bldg, but they've been trumped.  A burger order comes w/ either fries or potato/mixed salad.  Ordered the Cafe burger, the one w/ avocado.  About a half pound patty cooked just right.  Damn it was delicious.  All the burgers are $10-12...definitely worth it for the pound of food you get.  The location is quite nice since it's kind of segregated from the more densely populated areas, so there's not much of a wait for your food...usually 5-7 minutes.
author: Jeff S.

description:
I work around the area and once in a while when we get tired of other stuff around we go to Grumpy's.

The burgers are very decent and I've found both the fries and salad that come as side dishes really good.

The only complaint I have about this place is that they are slow. I mean, like sitting down and waiting about 20 minutes to get someone to bring you water and take your order. The wait staff always looks like they are in a frenzy but then when they do come over, they don't bother to apologize for the wait.

And speaking of wait, the place gets packed at lunch time and you can wait up to a half hour to get a table. They also like to do the "do you mind sitting at another table so a bigger party can take this table" B.S. and I can't stand that. The other day I saw them doing it to people who had their drinks already. Pathetic. 

So if you're going for a super early or super late lunch it may be a good experience. If you're going between 11:30 and 1:30 have a snack before heading out.
author: Vivi F.

description: Of course we like to think that grumpys came around soley for the purpose of the ad execs to get wasted after work but it's got something for everyone. Drinks are cheap, burgers are tastey, bartenders are friendly but often get overwhelmed. This bar is located right off battery in the ad ghetto, so rival agencies meet up and mingle, The wall is adorned with signs from the nearby agencies so it really feels like "our local hangout." not a great place for wine but the beer selection is good.
author: Nikki M.

description: So I've just been here once so far but I know I'll be going back Its apparently the hangout spot for the ad agency crew on lunch. The burgers are really fantastic--all three that my table had were perfectly cooked and they offer really original toppings along with your standard favorites. They also have a good beer selection on tap. My one complaint was that it gets super crowded--including the outside seating which is a lovely treat actually--so you may have to wait for a table and the service can be a touch slow. But worth the wait. Or just make sure you go when you have at least an hour to sit and sip a beer while casually munching and talking.
author: Lisa M.

description: If Grumpies succeeds in their fight to remove the Off the Grid food trucks from Front and Vallejo I will ensure I never patronize them again. And I will spread the word. Lunch options in the area are scant enough as it is. It makes no sense.
author: Mike L.

description:
This is a nice off the beaten path pub, that is relatively cheap, close to work, has out door patio, and excellent food. . . 

its simple, they serve good food, they have beer and top chef, its a good little place to sit out and enjoy the weather with out the mobs of financial district over flow you get at lunchtime...

ill keep this one just that simple folks..
oh and someone noted that this is one of the better burgers around, and they are right on...
author: jamie z.

description:
The macaroni and cheese here is to die for. I have been to Grumpy's a dozen times or more, and would kill for their mac and cheese recipe. You can substitute anything off the sides for it, and I highly encourage you do.

The burgers are awesome; fat and juicy. The fried chicken, lamb and trout items at the bottom of the menu are worth exploring, and reasonably priced. I had the grilled trout today, it took forever to come out, but it was good. Not sure if the bar girl took it off the bill because it was so late, or it was late because it never made it on the bill, but either way, it was free. Luckily they had some Fat Tire and Anchor Steam on tap, to while away the time waiting.

Overall, a great place, well worth the trek to get there. Just for that rich mac and cheese...
author: Joseph T.

description:
This place rules over other Financial District places with an iron fist. They put pulled pork on a bun WITH coleslaw. Together on the same sandwich!

And let's settle something about Macaroni and Cheese. When you crave Mac and Cheese, what do you crave? Some fancy ass stuff with stuffed alfalfa sprigs and wine reduction glaze or do you crave that stuff in the blue box that momma used to make?

Get over yourselves San Francisco, and quit hating on Grumpy's Mac and Cheese. That shit is good. And if you're too good for it, then guess what, you're probably the kind of person who has an asymmetrical haircut,  listens to Fergie, and is excited about the Sex and the City movie, and you are therefore booooooring. Ironic, considering old school Mac and Cheese is so boring it's amazing.
author: Justin L.

description: Damn good burgers and the fries were just as good. There are only a few places that can cook a burger to order and this is one of them.
author: Rocky S.

description: This place was pretty good I think I had a mushroom burger, It was good but not cheap. Ambiance is great, seems like there's a heavy lunch crowd, maybe get there early if you can't take a long lunch. Seems like a more fantastic location for drinks after work.  It's a bit far for lunch from work for me, but I met a friend here on the day I went. I probably wouldn't come back unless I was meeting friends.
author: C D.

description:
I like goin to this place when i wanna get out of the hustle and bustle of fidi, and enjoy some lunch with a companion outside. today in particular i knew i couldn't linger, so it was bam bam order food bam pay and conversation in between. so service was quick, and the burger was delish, though most impressive was their side green salad, which was actually a great big green salad with LOTS of lettuce and things. 

i will def go to grumpy's again for their out-of-the-way location, outdoor seating and good food.
author: Mikey B W.

description:
This place is alright with me. I met some friends there. they said it was their version of Cheers. And everyone did know their names.

They were celebrating one of their co-workers last day or something. They cracked me up with the story of how she didn't even order a drink and left. I ****finally**** got one of the best margaritas I've ever had. But apparently, it was too late to order any additional food. So I picked at cold french fries and rubber band calamari that was left on the group plates. They said the burgers were good there. I'll never know. 

The restroom was slightly scary. There was enough tissue and soap and towels. But the logistics were scary. Does this door lock? Does it stay locked? 

All in all, it was a fair experience. I was not spending the night there. I was just grabbing a quick drink after work. So it's alright with me for that...
author: Kelly G.

description:
Looking for a great burger and fries? Grumpy's is the place. Four stars if the service wasn't horrible. 

My diet coke conundrum continues...poor fountain diet coke. don't. do. it. Peraps it's best to stick with a beer..many from which to choose. 

Grumpy's is a bit crowded at lunch, but this spot is perfect if you are hungover and need some salt and grease.

The service is incredibly slow. I waited for one hour and 10 minutes for food today. This is quite UNacceptable as I only have an hour for lunch. The waiter dood was stellar, but it would have been nice for him to inform us what the hold up was. Only after inquiring about our food did he mention the to-go orders were being processed first. Oh, and the three tables that arrived after us but served first was a let down. 

No. fun.
author: Natalie C.

description:
Even with the wait and lack of tables, Grumpy's food has me salivating long before the lunch hour.  Their burgers are what burgers should be: thick, juicy, and full of flavor.  The burgers also come in many different styles - Popeye (with spinach and feta); Mushroom-Brie; etc.  Their onion rings are amazing, fresh, crunchy, and full of flavor.  Lots of good beer on tap (Fat Tire, Guiness, etc.) and they do serve other items if you aren't feeling burgers that day - fish; patty melts; chicken tenders and the like.

The only "grr" about the place is the wait, but with the food served, it is no wonder.  Key point to Grumpy's if you have a big group - send someone over ahead of time to hold a table, calling doesn't help.
author: Meghana A.

description:
Love this place! Great burgers, yummy fries and awesome service. 

They have about 10-12 different types of burgers and I think all are $9.95. Forget being healthy and forgo the turkey, veggie, and chicken option...stick with the beef patty! At least try it once! It's juicy, flavorful and substantial. 

I hear the happy hour is good too. You won't leave grumpy! ;P
author: Yee-Shing W.

description: Such a loud place you can't even hear what your friends are telling you.  We had to constantly yelled at each other to keep the conversation going.  Burger was alright.  Nothing special.  French fries was so soggy and oily that I only had one.  And you can totally smell the oil from the fryer.  I definitely won't return.
author: Uinii H.

description:
burgers ok, chicken burger always over done.

and their coke is always watered down and just doesn't work.  never fixed.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Grumpy's.........It is what it is, a Bar with a limited lunch menu. my co-workers love it but I wasn't too impress. If you plan on going there for lunch get there by 11:30 or else you'll be standing for a while because seating is limited. Thinking about having a conversation during lunch? Pluuzee! bring your blow-horn, it is noisy and loud. But than again it's a bar.
 
Overall the food is okay if you're into hamburgers.
author: Herbert D.

description:
The designated burger joint for "Advertising Row".  Hawaiin shirt adorning creatives, cracked out account executives, and party hardy media teams all gather into Grumpy's for beers and one of the best burgers in the hood.  You literally rub elbows with some interesting people here.  Cramped tables add to the intimate setting.  Lots of dollar bills are strangely stuck to the ceiling... perhaps some creative briefs too!  

Get the turkey burger.  Just get it.  It's worth the 30 min prep time!  Your conference call to NY and Redmond can wait.  Filling your belly with a ketchup smothered turkey burger with fries is more rewarding than budgeting $50 mill worth of billings.
author: Chris T.

description:
Awesome burgers for sure, any place that will add a fried egg to a bacon cheese burger is ok with me. Just don't try to move too fast for a few hours after eatiing one. 

Try it out on a Thursday evening for 4$ pint glass Margaritas.
author: matt l.

description:
Hidden area of the Financial District - The BEST burgers I've ever had. My favorite is the "California" which includes Monterey jack cheese, bacon, ortega chile & sour cream. It comes with either french fries, potato salad or mixed green salad. The mixed salad is fresh and comes in a big portion and the fries are crispy and so GOOD!
Also, this is a cool place to go for happy hour. Not too much of a selection but they have good appetizers & beer. 
Only open M-F from 8am - 10pm but sometimes they close early if it's slow.
author: Deb C.

description: Good food, cheap prices, and beers on tap. Dingy little hole in the wall bar, but a good spot to grab breakfast/lunch/dinner when in the financial district. Friendly service brings me back every time.
author: Mark H.

description: I LOVE Grumpy's!  Total hole in the wall but great burgers.  My favorite is the Baja Burger!!  My son loves the Western. The place gets VERY busy at lunchtime so get there early.  They cook everything to order so it does take a while.
author: Karen C.

description:
i love hole in the walls!

I had a yummy burger and they had great selection of their specialty burgers. i love it.

call me boring but i still just go for mushroom and swiss burgers :DD

next time ill sit out doors... i love outdoor seating!!!
author: Andrea G.

description: Awesome food. Dive bar atmosphere. Great bartender/ wait staff. Bartender accidentally dropped a burger and gave it to us on the house. The replacement came out quick. He was extremely apologetic. I ordered a Baja Burger complete with avocado, bacon, "jack," and fresh salsa. It was delicious! One of the better burgers I've ever had. Very fresh ingredients. The people I came with got other burgers and loved them too! The onion rings and potato salad were excellent as well! I highly recommend it.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Back in the dot-com boom (version 1.0) I worked across the street from Grumpy's in the two story brick warehouse.  It was great.  We used to call Grumpy's our satellite office because so many people would relocate there for "heavy thinking" during the day.   I had Grumps on speed dial in my office so I could order up a hot dog for lunch (though they changed suppliers on those and the quality went rapidly downhill for no reason).   I remember when we'd throw massive parties in our company and people would shout down to the people drinking at Grumpy's that we had free booze, and yeah, we did.  I had never drunk to excess (I was a deprived child) before my nights at Grumpy's, but that bar put me down a path to a more interesting life.

Those were good times.  They didn't last.  They never do.
author: Beau G.

description:
i was organizing a co-worker's goodbye party and searching for a place with outdoor searching.  I called Grumpy's to ask if they had enough outdoor seating for 20+ people, and they said "Definitely! Come on by!"

When we arrived, there were two tiny tables (prob enough seating for 7-8 ppl, max) outside in front, and both were already taken. Sad face.  

I also didn't discern anything particularly unique or outstanding about this bar....food & drinks were average in quality and taste, and the decor was pretty standard. In sum: meh.
author: Sid D.

description:
Have a business lunch where no one is really interested in eating lunch but everyone talks about lunch and then pass around a couple menus and you pick one together that is totally arbitrary but will deliver some overpriced food you can expense?

This is one of those places.  Just fine.  does the job.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: Another place I used to go to when I worked nearby. I loved the grumpy's. Really good breakfast! Really good Burgers! Club Sammys, Onion Rings, and Alcohol! haha. The staff was really friendly, we hung out and talked to them alot. I think the 2 guys are gone now :0( Well I left my dollar bill on the ceiling of Grumpys, when you go find it! It has my name on it :0)
author: Karen T.

description:
Grumpy's is literally a block away from my work and when I don't feel like walking far, I end up picking up a burger or breakfast food based solely on convenience of their location.  The food is good, but is a bit overpriced.  Their prices have gone up quite a bit since I first stopped by and its odd because I've only been at my current job for about a year.

I can't really say that its great or awful.  It's a cool little hole in the wall spot and every time I've been there the service has been pretty good.  I have yet to go for Happy Hour, but I hear its good.  Maybe if I go for Happy Hour they'll get bumped up a star.

As for now, its decent food for the location, but I would never go out of my way to eat there.
author: Ruben P.

description:
Grumpy Burgers are good. Grumpy Fries are good. I swear all of their food is Sysco, but somehow they make it all tasty. Perhaps they fry their food in Bacon grease, I hear that makes anything taste good. 

Minus one star for the crowd at lunch. Not Grumpy's fault, but still irritating to wait too long or loose a table over an office crowd.
author: Amanda L.

description:
One of the best "scecret spots" in the City and even though its in the Financial, you'll see guys in suits sitting next to bike messengers and such.

They got Fat Tire, Fernet, decent whiskey and good burgers-what more could you ask for?

Order your fries "Patrick Style" if you want 'em crunchy!
author: Sam P.

description:
Pretty great spot for a hangover cure.  This is a wonderful place for a vegetarian because you can make any of their specialty burgers into a veggie burger (or grilled chicken, or a turkey burger...). 

I most clearly remember the Greek- with avocado, cucumber and feta- but I don't like the mushiness of the avo (more like guacamole).  I'm leaning towards the regular, no-fuss veggie, with good ol' mustard and catchup these days.  It's very good!

Also, there is something to be said about their "side" salad, which I normally get instead of fries.  It's a huge pile of greenery, with all sorts of beans, veggies and hard boiled eggs on top.  Get the balsamic dressing-- it is tangy and a little sweet and PERFECT.

One odd thing I notice about this pub is that no one ever knows how to make a black velvet.  Hm...
author: Allison G.

description:
Yet another place I settle for to get lunch. They have pretty good burgers, and the Southern Fried Chicken is not that bad. Obviously I don't expect much from a pub, but a life saver when you don't know what you want for lunch.

This place is definitely popping after work, though.
author: Rommel N.

description:
Where is the best place to listen to the bartenders iTunes play list while sippin' on Spatan? Grumpy's!
Probably my favorite place just outside of the downtown area because of the no-nonsense bartending. I once tried to order a fancy shot for my friend and was looked at sideways...can't say I minded at all...I was given a whiskey shot instead and was pleasantly surprised by the bartenders choice for me.
Prices are on point - perfect for a impromptu happy hour after a long day at work. Plus - for first timers - if you can stick a dollar to the ceiling - you get a free drink on the house.
author: Katy A.

description:
The burgers here are outrageous...outrageously juicy!!...The juices were dripping off of the burgers to the point where I can't tell which is the grease or the au jus...My friends swear to this place...the fries were first rate.  Also try out their many choices of booze...I favor the light Anchor steam...(friends call me a wuss for going "light", but I gotta watch the calories!!!)

Also try out their breakfast grub...they make a mean mushroom/veggie omelette...I don't happen to like their potato hash..they were chunks of potatoes with no flavoring. Kinda bland.  The toast they offer is usually saturated with buttery goodness, so watch out!

Parking is a pain here, there's tons of meters, and lots of overpriced lots...Best bet on a weekday, just take Muni and walk along the Embarcadero.
author: Pauline L.

description:
Solid bar food, good drink selection. Cheap drinks, moderate food prices. Friendly staff. Would definitely go again.

And you might run into the occasional ABC, CBS, NBC TV/ News people there.

Celebrity siting so far- Mike Roe from Dirty Jobs and Jaime Heyiman (sp) from Myth Busters
3 1/2 stars.
author: Eddy N.

description: SF's hidden gem. Best burgers in town. Meat melts in your mouth. If you are trying to watch your girlish figure, the side salad is huge and tasty. I would recommend the Super burger. Fried egg, bacon..... heaven.
author: Brian S.

description: If you are in the financial, and need a spot for a pint that isn't crawling with DB's... go here. It is worth the walk, and the place is filled with a ton of people who work for the local news channels. They are friendly, and kind of like pirates in some weird way. It's off the beaten path, and has a sense of atmosphere. I recommend the Baja burger daily drink special. Only downside is they are not open on weekends, and you kind feel like you are far away when you get drunk enough to rally.
author: John P.

description:
I work only 3 blocks away, so we end up ordering lunch from "Ye olde standby" frequently.
There are many options or "styles" of burgers, which keeps things interesting if you're eating here every other week. Also, their salads are always fresh and delicious. Although recently, they've been skimping on the dressing, big time. Seriously, less than half a plastic cup of vinaigrette for my whole salad? 
"Who is responsible for this, Jorge?!?"

The service is efficient and friendly. The pub-like interior is a authentic mix of brick, dollars stuck to the ceiling, and old (and current) ad agency logos and signs, which is appropriate, considering the neighborhood.

Additionally, it's a fun place to hang out with friends after work. If it's nice out, grab a seat at a sidewalk table. Or sit inside and watch some senior citizens play baseball on TV.... Oh! Those ARE the Giants. Just kidding Giants, I love you guys.
author: Chadwick M.

description:
Well, I'm old school at this place, been going here since 1982, in fact before it was named Grumpy's.  For the old timers, they'll remember it as McGovern's.

This place is a classic and since I've been going there, the place has seen the rise of the TV stations grow around it (KPIX, KGO & KNTV), to the sprouting of numerous radio stations and of course the arrival and demise of various ad agencies around it.  Then it's seen the ol' 480 freeway demolished after the quake of '89 and following that the dot com boom and the ensuing bust and here we go again, another rally with the hi-tech industry, hence Web 2.0.  That's a brief history surrounding Grumpy's, now you're up to speed.

But what's consistent about Grumpy's (I'm not a lunch crowd type there, but a frequent after-work crowd...huge dif), is how their bartenders (several over the years) somehow always attain a true and sincere measure of grumpiness.  After they've been working there awhile, they all turn out like Jack Nicholson in the Shining, "all work and no play makes Jack a dull boy."

In the end, it is a neighborhood bar that happens to be in the Barbary Coast business section at the edge of the stuffy Financial District at the foot of Telegraph Hill.  There aren't too many suits, but they're welcome anyway for a drink or so.

Meanwhile, whole tribes from several neighboring companies come to unwind after work, wax poetic about their day's toils and even mingle with members of the other tribes.  It is a friendly bar, not because of the bartenders, but because of the patrons.

So if you come, brace yourself for an unfriendly service, but be entertained by the shenanigans of the natives...most likely to be seen after 5 pm.

Update as of December 2008.  They have a cool new bartender, Sean.  So, Sean, we're waiting for the day your turn ahem, Grumpy.
author: Arvey S.

description:
My first visit to Grumpy's was certainly a good one..I came on a lunch date and the conversation was good, but the food was even better! I ordered the tuna melt and my oh my...was it delicious!  My date said that the burgers there are always awesome, so i might have to try one of those next time...there's a nice bar inside, beers on tap, and small cozy sitting area right outside on the sidewalk. Perfect for a nice sunny day.  
I would definitely come back to, as a matter of fact..i'm craving one of those tuna melts right now!
author: Lulu C.

description: You've gotta order one of the burgers here. It's a BURGER place, first and foremost. I went with friends and wasn't really in the mood for one, but it seemed like the right thing to do. Turns out, it was a fabulous burger. Cheese and pesto. We sat outside on a lovely autumn day. Good thing we did, because later when I went inside to use the rest room, I found myself blasted by the volume of the TV and other diners. This Friday lunchtime crowd was very noisy.
author: Paula H.

description: I've admittedly become somewhat obsessed with Grumpy's. I work right across the street making it super easy to phone in an order and hop over to pick it up. Their pub grub is pitch perfect. Grumpy's burgers, sandwiches and appetizers are on point. The ingredients are fresh and prepared right. They have great drink specials and they atmosphere is cozy and welcoming. The staff is friendly and the prices are low. Doesn't get much better than that. I love it.
author: Maya B.

description: I'm a Grumpy's convert. Great local happy hour that includes $3 Tecate tall cans on Fridays. Yummy all beef hotdogs with cheese and onions. Incredibly crowded during weekday lunch unless you get there at 11:45 or earlier. Good crowd overall and friendly bartenders.
author: Natalie N.

description:
ask Kevin the bartender if you can see the prisoners chained up in the cellar....it's cool!

UPDATE: Kevin is gone but Josh my man, you are a honorable replacement. 

they serve burgers here?
author: slapaham s.

description:
I work right around the corner from Grumpy's and never even knew it existed! This place is a total dive, but somehow draws the pretentious crowds of the nearby advertising agencies, which I will have to admit, I am part of. I am excited to go back to Grumpy's for an after work beer with the co-workers or another lunch.

The place was packed, but somehow we got the last table for the six of us and didn't have to wait at all. All of the guys ordered hamburgers and my female co-worker and I both ordered salads...go figure. The hamburgers looked delicious as long as you don't get it well done or as it states on the wall, "like shoe leather." I got the Summer salad, which was really good and had chicken, feta, mango, avocado, tomatoes & garbanzo beans on it. You can order each of the hamburgers replaced with chicken if desired or you can choose any of the many other sandwiches on the menu. They also have various types of appetizers, fried chicken, and macaroni & cheese on the menu that sound great!

The service was pretty good, not great and the wait staff was friendly enough. I will definitely make the short trip back to Gumpy's soon...maybe even tomorrow!
author: Elaine S.

description:
Oh my God that was a tasty meal. I had  the chicken basil sandwich. Best one I have had in years. The chicken was juicy, not dry like lots of palces I go to. I work over at the Piers,a nd I mentioned it for lunch. SO I got food to go, and everybody is praising this place in my office.
I will be going back, next time with friends for drinks and dinner.
author: Adam B.

description: I would give it 5 stars but it would detract from my yelp legitimacy. Great for happy hour--just out of reach of the financial district so not a lot of suits (not that there's anything wrong with that). Great ambiance and crowd--great staff--simple...the way a bar should be.
author: Josh A.

description:
I first discovered Grumpy's several years ago when a friend and I were wandering around town on a Friday afternoon and happened by it and decided to go in for a beer.  Fast forward to bartime: we're still sitting at the bar with our new buddy, Jimmy, the bartender.  

While Grumpy's didn't exactly become a regular haunt, I do still enjoy going there.  The food is good as well as the beer selection, and the bartenders are friendly.  I went for lunch the other day and found that the table service wasn't great, but you can order food at the bar and I've had good service when I've done that.  If you work in the FiDi or Embarcadero area, Grumpy's is a great place to go for a beer after work.
author: Sara H.

description:
Great burgers!  For the price I rather eat here than bistro burger anyday.  My personal favorite is the baja burger medium rare.  

nice piece of meat with bacon cheese and salsa over the top.

Choice of potato salad, green salad or fries.

Fries are always packed in the container when you arrive to they retain freshness.

Drinks are cheap and strong.

Definitley a great burger joint.
author: Patrick T.

description:
I went here for lunch today and ordered the salmon. It was raw in the middle and was missing the veggies it was supposed to come with, so I sent it back. 
The exact same piece of salmon came back out, charred black. I also got veggies this time but they were mushy. I was starving so I ate them anyway, but I sent the salmon back again.
They cooked a fresh piece of salmon for the third attempt, but this too came out raw in the middle. Come on, now. Salmon, like most fish, cooks quickly. I was too tired to try again, and it had been over an hour, so the waitress just took it off my bill. That was nice of her, but I won't be going back.
author: Beth C.

description:
This was my first visit to Grumpy's and I do believe I will be a patron of this establishment once more because I liked it and the food was good.  I tried their Turkey Pastrami Ruben with a side of shoestring fries (to which I am told is not the normal fry type, steak fry is the normal selection).  The bread was well toasted, but the kraut and pastrami 'juice' made it a little soggy.  The turkey pastrami and kraut were very good and I will be having that sandwich again.

The atmosphere is fitting as a pub, with mystery dollars tacked to the ceiling.  Some of the dollars are intricately placed and folded causing me to wonder how the dollars are placed there along with the obvious why.
author: Ron S.

description: Had lunch with a friend here.  Great service, good food (I had a chicken salad), and a decent beer selection.  It's a nice, laid-back place I'll definitely visit again.
author: Robert M.

description: Great burgers and good service. This place is a casual place to grab a beer and munch on some good pub food. I had the cafe style angus burger with garlic fries and I wasn't disappointed. The burger was big and juicy and the fries had mounds of garlic on them. I LOVE garlic so this was a big plus in my book. The bar has a good selection of beers on tap too. I recommend this place for a fun, casual get together with friends while in the city.
author: Melissa C.

description:
I will probably never give out 5 stars, kinda like Michelin being so stingy with the 3 star rating. I just feel like five stars is kinda unattainable, you would have to have a world class chef and a bartender serving only you. That said, the fact that Grumpy's, with the grill guy chefs and emo bartenders, earns four stars is saying something. I work at a construction site right around the corner and my food is usually ready at 12 which is a plus because I get a half hour for lunch. I always order the Super cause, well, it's super. Fried egg and bacon on a burger? MMMMmmmmm!

Good atmosphere for afternoon drinking too. We took over the bar with 10 plumbers one day before Christmas, it was great times.
author: David G.

description: Grumpy burger! And a beer! My favorite burger place in that part of town. Don't be fooled by the pub-like appearance. (wait, it IS a pub). The burgers are great. Absolutely tasty. And the fries are good as well. Why 4 stars? Everything I've tried besides the burgers has been pretty much ho-hum. So, if you like a pub-like choice of beer and a really good burger, and, by the way, outside seating on a sunny day. This is the place.
author: Rich M.

description: Like most places in the Levi's Plaza area - this is not a weekend spot. Nor is this a spot that you go to past 8 on a weekday. It is solely for business hours and work happy hours. That being said - this is a great bar to come for a drink with coworkers after 5. They also have great take out for lunch - great burgers and fries along with your typical fried bar fare. It's a little pricey for what you get, but hey - its Levi's Plaza - not too many other options around.
author: Esther A.

description: I work nearby and even hosted a happy hour here for colleagues. Friendly service, busy and happy atmosphere and great specials ;-)
author: Anny P.

description: You could argue that Grumpy's is a three-star kind of joint, and I wouldn't fight you.  But for me, Grumpy's is easily four stars, for a number of reasons.  I've had many a wonderful, after-work happy hour here.  They have Stella on tap when I'm feeling light, Guinness on tap when I'm feeling dark.  It's not too loud to carry on a conversation with your friend or party, unlike Old Ship down the street.  When I've chanced to eat the food, it is very tasty.  For me, Grumpy's is the old standby - the comfy pair of pajamas that you want to put on at the end of a long day.  Ain't nothing wrong with that.
author: Mariah M.

description:
Let me describe my experience...its long...but its valuable and embelished only where necessary....

Two co-workers and I walked down to Grumpy's over a Friday lunch break to grab a burger and a beer.  We had heard that their burgers were awesome, and wanted to give it a shot since it was in walking distance from our office.  We assumed we could get in & out of there in an hour to an hour and 15 minutes, but man were we wrong!  We were seated and given abundant time to review the menu before our waiter finally came over to take our orders.  I ordered a western burger, while my two buddies ordered the same burger...only one with no mayo and fries....the other as-is with potato salad.  We also got a beer-a-piece.  About 30 minutes and a pint later, it dawns on us that 1) our food has not arrived, and 2) the two tables that were seated 10 minutes after us were at least 8 bites into their lunches.  After one friend mutters the token, "What...are they killin' the cow back there?" the bus boy comes by to ask us if we need a refresher on our brewskies.  We collectively agreed, "We've got no food to cram in our mouths, so bring us another round, bus boy!"  (side note: our waiter was not seen for these 30 minutes)  Just as the bus boy brings us our 2 beers (side note: we ordered 3!!), we noticed our waiter crawled out of the black hole he fell in and was bringing out our food.  (side note: 40 minutes had passed from the time we ordered)  The orders were screwed up...everything had mayo on it and one guy got the other's potato salad...it was a mess.  Once the mayo mistake was brought to the attention of the our re-established waiter, he opted to go back to the kitchen and bring out a plain bun to my buddy and had him take care of it himself.  Nice work.

After all of this, we were pretty torqued, but were happy with the results of the burgers.  They were tasty.  (side note: 1 hr. and 15 min. had passed from ordering to finishing the food)  Since our waiter was paying no attention to us, we had to flag him down like a airport runway worker just to get our check.  Then...surprise!! ...he brought us the wrong bill.  For 3 guys consuming 3 burgers and 5 beers, he was charging us $115.  Our calm, happy-go-Friday demeanors were slipping to the dark side.  I called to him from two tables away saying, "This is not our check."  He went back, brought us a check for around $50-something and said, "Thanks for coming in today guys!!"  Our pleasure.

We promptly paid with cash, and left him a $5 tip.  (side note: we are not cheap restaurant guests, we just tip appropriately)  We begin walking down the sidewalk, back to our office after an hour and  1/2 lunch when we hear, "Hey guys!! Was something wrong??"  Our waiter, rigid and red-faced was chasing us down the sidewalk in search of an explanation.  Without missing a beat, we listed off all of the 7 or 8 GLARING errors that were made.  Waiter says, "Well, OK, I just wanted to know because I've been having problems with the kitchen all day."  Other niceties were exchanged and I ended by saying, "But my burger was good."  

When I was a waiter, I would blame stuff on the kitchen too in order to save a tip, but this was b.s. because the dude was not even around for 90% of our lunch.  There is no way it was the kitchen's fault.  The bus boy gave us better service than he did, and he even screwed up by bringing two beers for three people.

Horrible, horrible experience.  But the burger was good.  There is no way I, or my two buddies, will be going back.
author: Adam B.

description: I LOVE GRUMPY'S! I have many fond memories of drinking beers and eating delicious greasy pub food. Grumpy's fries are the BEST. They started serving different fries for a while after management changed but I think the change was short-lived. My favorite meal here is the tuna melt with fries and a pint of Bass, or two. ::drool::
author: Queenie C.

description: Two words: Sean and Kevin. These are hands down my two favorite bartenders in the city. Even my boyfriend loves them. Go meet them. You will thank me. Pitchers are the best value, burgers are fantastic. and there is dice behind the bar. Doesn't get much better than that. Now if they were only open for brunch...
author: Lindsay S.

description: The burgers & onion rings are to die for! Friendly fast service. Great atmosphere. What more could I ask for?
author: Brian C.

description: First off the service is slow as hell, forget going at lunch the place is packed and you won't get in. The beer and turkey burger is good. The place is small so you often end up sitting too close to strangers. Did I mention how slow the service is? yeah slow. Oh and it's loud, but there is a fun ambiance to it, would be so much better if they expanded.
author: King O.

description: There's nothing fancy about this place and that is part of what makes it such a find. Since we moved our office to the neighborhood last year I'm eating at Grumpy's a whole lot more often than I should! The burgers are off the chart and the bar is second to none. It is your dream of what a cool, low-key neighborhood pub is supposed to be.
author: Kevin E.

description: Went there for the first time today after finding it on yelp, left after ordering and waiting 45 minutes for food which never came. Very disappointed. It is also very, very loud.
author: Kiki M.

description: Take out was fantastic. Tuna Melts fries and salad. And not a long wait even when crowded with a helpful bar staff.
author: Eamonn S.

description: Ahh The Grumps. This place has become a staple for those of us that work in the area. I have been known to frequent Grumpys as many as 4 times in one day. They have great burgers especially because you can have any version with your choice of turkey, veggie, chicken, or beef. Staff is cool and they great happy hour specials. A very respectful crowd except yo get your occasional ad douche. Some of them even get their pictures on the wall.
author: Justin H.

description: As others have said... the best burger I have found in the FiDi. Worth the walk. Juicy, delicious... my lunch destination any time my coworkers and I are feeling a burger... Haven't tried anything else here, and not sure why I would...
author: Scott K.

description: Love love love their burgers! I've had the Greek and the Baja burgers. Portions are huge for a girl, you could share of course! If it is your first time visit, make sure take a dollar bill and stick it to the ceiling for good luck! They also have weekday happy hours. The restaurant gets busy between 11:30 - 1:30 for lunch people.
author: Yi-Bing Z.

description: good ole Grumps! Hasn't done me too wrong as of yet- so I've gone to this place more times than i can count in the last 5 years- Breakfast: great. Lunch: yummy. Dinner: never been! This is a during the workday food/drink place- after hour drink specials... small place, nice peeps...they have awesome bacon!
author: Ricquel N.

description:
only at there for lunch - i'm new to the neighborhood.  my salad was surprisingly good, very tasty grilled chicken. 

the waitress was quite the space cadett...

excited to go back and try a cheeseburger!  and maybe a beer for post work hours...
author: jessie h.

description: Best damn burger in the Financial Dist if not the city! Just ate there again today with 3 other compadres. The freakin burger was perfect. Soft warm bun...nicely melted gooey cheddar, and they even have Grey Poupon (best mustard) the rest is yellow/brownish crappola. Diet Coke was mixed to perfection. All in all great lunch. Even had a side show of a couple trying to have a meaningful conversation. This place is LOUD. Perfect for eating and certainly not reading some lame ass book at the bar while scarfing down a Mushroom burger. At least it wasn't a Starbuckian with a lap top.
author: Anthony P.

description: OK I went there again and now there are four reasons i like Grumpy's. One, the food is good. Two, the service is awesome. Three, the price is right. Four, the turkey burger is tasty. You have to check this place out. It lacks pretension and feels like home; a good home ;).
author: David D.

description: This place has the best turkey burger in town! Around my office, Friday is known as Grumpy's Turkey Burger Day!
author: Anna S.

description: Love Grumpy's. Turkey Pastrami on Rye is awesome.  Whole burger variety menu is nice.  Staff is friendly and has always been accommodating with large groups and/or baby.
author: Courtney C.

description:
It is a good after work place.... no boohaahaas.... nice & friendly bartenders...  Mostly filled with ppl from abc & nearby offices which makes it better for me to be around since I dont see my own kind. 

It is my kinda place & would definitely recommend it for my friends.
author: Mitt G.

description: Any burger that requires three napkins to finish is a good burger in my book... then there's that whole idea of Guiness with lunch. Now I need a nap. When I'm done with that, I'll be back for some buffalo wings.. ..
author: David R.

description: Ahh Grumpy's...how I enjoy your burger. Why must people always occupy your space when I desire sustenance from your kitchen? I will have to come back another day and taste that savory burger even though I must shed more money that I would like.
author: Jonathan L.

description: My review is for their lunch, I have not had the opportunity to check out their Happy Hour yet.  I came in on a friday just after noon and was immediately able to sit down.  Service was really quick and the servers were very friendly.   I got the French Burger with a side of garlic fries.  $10.50 seems a lot for a burger but I was surprised on how big this burger was.  I will definietly be making two meals out of it.
