When I got the bill, there was a $1.50 difference between the check and the subtotal so I asked the waiter and he explained that the Garlic Fries are extra so be forewarned when the waiter is going through the available sides for the burgers that Garlic Fries and Onion Rings are an additional charge.  I would recommend adding that line underneath the available sides so they don't get anyone upset in the future over hidden charges.  But overall, it was a great meal.  If the prices were a little cheaper I would have given it 5 stars but hey, this is San Francisco, and the place seems to be pretty popular.  I just wish it were open during the weekends.
author: Scott G.

description: I'm going to miss being less than two blocks away from this place. The burgers and salads are pretty tasty, and the beer is cheap. What else do you need from a lunch and after work happy hour joint? I mean, really?
author: Jenn G.

description:
Good drinks.  Good prices.  Good place to unwind at the end of the day or grab a really good burger and fries.

I work in the area and have been coming here off and on for the past couple of years.  I usually go in for a quick pint or two in the evening.  
I have noticed the  food has been getting really really  good in the recent few months. Before the quality of the food was just okay.  But now-whatever these guys are doing in the kitchen is working.  Everything seems to cooked to the right temperature, juicier and plain just more fresh.  

Try the Super...hands down one of the best burgers in San Francisco.
author: keith t.

description: Hands down, the best burgers in the financial district area
author: Roddster V.

description: One of the better places for lunch in the neighborhood. Good burgers and salads. Once upon a time, I was pleasantly surprised by their fried chicken too. Their Guinness is a hit or miss though, a few times it was sour! Blech.
author: Lester L.

description: Great neighborhood feel - even in this non-neighborhood part of town.  Surprisingly good food - burgers are great, as are salads.  Wine is terrible, but then who goes to a pub to have good wine?  Great cheap beer on tap and bottles - every seems to know everyone else's name.  A great place for lunch or happy hour - no pretense and a good place for groups of friends.
author: Christina S.

description: I take that back. Burgers are pretty tasty, but if it's not lunch time, forget it. They close the kitchen early and send the guy home. And waiting for a drink while the bartender cleans tables and plays dice... SUCKS!
author: Michael A.

description:
eh-hem!

can you please put the Frank Black CD on again? then and only then will I buy one of your sweet juicy blue cheese hamburgers for $10.
author: Dave S.

description: Great place to go for lunch break. Cool pub, plus good burgers.
author: Scott T.

description: The only thing going for the place is its beer selection.  Even that was tempered by the fact that they had their Guinness running off CO2 instead of nitrous.  The mac & cheese tasted like velveeta.  Just a big disappointment for me.
author: Joe W.

description: Great Burgers.....great drinks.....great atmosphere. I spend at least one day a week here getting wrecked. If you want to eat lunch...arrive no later than 11am....Or...wait until after 1:30. Too many suits.
author: Karl N.

description: The burger was slightly bigger than average.  The service was extremely fast, but then again I was the only 1 at the place.  I definitely want to return for happy hour, and they have a $4 margarita special on Thursdays from 4pm til closing.  Too bad I had lunch at 2:30 and still had work to return to.  I like their thinly cut fries and they had a large selection of alcohol, but I had to settle for a bottled root beer instead.  They have a good selection of rock music playing too, and their trap door which was right by my table was a nice touch.
author: Andy L.

description: Killer man!  This place totally rocks.  So many choices of burgers and beers.  And it's off the beaten path of the financial district, so it's not totally busy during the week.  I guess it can get a little busy during lunch, but it's lunch time, so expect it.  Duh!  Nevertheless, mmm, makes me want a burger right now.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: Great American food, hearty portions, and good selection of beer. Nice servers and cute bartenders, friendly vibe all around. Depending on which you order, food can run a little steep. Service can be agonizingly slow, especially during lunch. Fills up real fast. But worth the wait.
author: Clar L.

description: I run by this place all the time and always want to stop and check it out.  I went yesterday after work and had a great experience.  $6 for a pint of Anchor and shot of Jameson!  I hear the food is great and they have plenty of flat screens showing sports.  Outdoor seating to boot.  Next time I go running, I'm bringing some cash.
author: Corey V.

description:
i live a few blocks away from this place.  for the longest time i had no idea there was a restaurant/pub right there because it's located in the no-man's land between the FiDi and the touristy fisherman's wharf area.  surprise... when i walked by one time in the evening to see that there was a bit of a crowd hanging outside this place.  seems like there's a bit of a hidden gem that only the locals knew about?

I finally get a chance to go to grumpy's the other day for happy hour and dinner and as expected, there's a crowd standing outside, each man with a glass of beer in hand.  inside was a little crowded but my friends and i were able to get a table.  we sit for a while, and realize that we're supposed to order our food at the bar.  (is that right, folks?  geez, i hope that's true.  if it's not, then i wonder how long it would have taken before an waiter served us.)  for the record, at least in my experience, you're supposed to order your food at the bar.  

i ordered a lagunitas IPA and a reuben burger.  the bartender was a really nice and friendly guy but forgot to ask me how i liked my burger done.  at least the food came out fast, and it was delish.  

grumpy's has a pretty decent selection of beer on tap (lagunitas IPA, anchor steam, anchor porter, guiness, stella, widmer, trumer, sierra nevada, spaten lager, fat tire... ) and happy hour is $4, which is OK.  They also have other happy hour specials, such as $4 margarita thursdays.  

my friends have tried and liked the baja burger and the california burger.  i hear the fish and chips are alright but you can get better elsewhere. 

the crowd looks like there were quite a few regulars, most likely the after-work crowd from the neighboring offices and the bartenders seem really friendly and cool.  the quality of service doesn't seem to be their forte but sometimes i'm ok with that, as long as they're not straight up rude.  i could see myself being a regular here... maybe.  it's alright.
author: Christy I.

description: Haven't been here after hours to enjoy the beers yet but the lunches are damn good. Tons of items to choose from including a Shrimp Po'boy that's really good. I no longer have to wish that McDonald's will one day start selling the shrimp filet like they have in Japan.
author: James C.

description: If my stomach could speak, it would say one word about these burgers...'AWESOME!'  I love this place! I usually check this place out for lunch about 3 times a month if not more.  The burger patties are actually quarter pounders when they are cooked not before they grill them.  The meat is cooked to your liking and is always juicy and tender.  My favorite burger is the bacon cheeseburger. Standard, however you will never be disappointed.  Another bonus, is the steak fries and onion rings are cooked to perfection.  They are never overcooked or soggy like some other places.  This place definitely gets a two thumbs up with a fork and spoon ready to eat rating.  Downside, this place is a pub and rather small so if you are in a big group try to get there early before the lunch rush.
author: James M.

description: If you want great burgers that are really filling and not overpriced, then this is the place. Their signature sandwiches are really good too. Word of caution; it gets really busy during lunchtime and try to ignore the sides and focus on the burger/sandwich itself or you'll find yourself full in no time.
author: Gary T.

description: A little tight at lunch time, but the friendly staff makes you comfortable regardless of how close your neighbor is.  The turkey burger is wonderful, but bring a breath mint for after lunch.
author: ellyk E.

description: They have a cool bartender called Mary.  She serves the best pint of Boddington's around!  Greasy bar food + shots of Fernet on special = a perfect Friday Happy Hour.
author: Beth G.

description: This is a killer little bar that i only heard of by accident.  The booze flows like water and the afterwork crowd is nice and rambunctious...  just the way i like it.  Also, great choice of finger foods for when you are "having dinner" before a night out...  yeah, they are all fried (well and burgers), but what else do you want while you are pounding a few pints?
author: Robert R.

description: Good burgers and large salads.  They can be too busy on Fridays at lunch time.
author: T-Bone L.

description: Food's OK, but the service blows (at lunch time). Not bad for drinks after work, bartender's a good guy.
author: Andy D.

description: YUM! Great burgers - tons of choices. Their garden salad comes with chick peas, beans and egg! So good. The fries are also good and my co-worker swears their breakfast sandwiches are a must! Good service but prices are on the higher-end ($8-9/burger).
author: Gladys C.

description: good spot for a burger and beer in the financial district.  for a bar, they have a solid variety of foods on the menu and interesting burger specials.  i tried the mushroom brie and it totally filled my burger fix for the week.
author: Helen T.

description: Good for drinks after work. Decent burgers at lunch, ok fries. I liked the variety of options for the burgers as well...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Burgers and salads?  Why?  If any of you engage in this mockery of American culture, please explain your reasons to me.  I'm only taking off a star for the service.  Otherwise, the bacon cheeseburger with mushrooms has been known as a highlight of many a dark day at work.
author: Beth V.

description: Best turkey burger ever.  Go early and go hungry!  I crave their burgers in the morning and always relish eating the Western. Mmm!  So good.  For a burger, usually runs you about $12 a person.
author: Cindy F.

description: The food is decent. Good for drinks during and after work. Nice because it is close to work. The service is excellent, though! You should also ask them to make the publicis lion roar! Burgers are a little pricey for just burgers, but they are pretty yummy.
author: Pika C.

description:
We frequent this neighborhood spot for happy hour.  They have great appetizers and good beer.  What more could you ask for?  oh yeah, good prices and happy, buzzed friends all around.

Breakfast: try their egg & cheese sandwich....the last time I had it it comes with country potatoes and is only $3.50!  For lunch I like their turkey burgers...YUM!
author: Mary H.

description: I like the Turkey burgers and the pitchers of beer.
author: Adrienne G.

description:
the pub obviously wasn't named for the demeanor of the staff.  the servers and bartenders were sweet, smiling, and good natured.  but the 4 stars is for the speed with which our HUGE lunches were served, the diverse burger menu, and the bang for your lunch buck.

like they understand that you only have 1 hour for lunch, and half of that is taken up by transit to and from the office.  the staff was quick, the burgers filling, and the taste: sensational.

i wouldn't recommend the onion rings, but the side salads are enormous and the toppings on the burgers took up half the plates!  not to mention that you could have your burger in beef, turkey, chicken, or tofu!!!  i would recommend the turkey burger: it wasn't dry like most turkey burgers, and perfectly seasoned.

i can't wait to go back and try one of everything.  thank goddess for a new lunch destination in the northern embarcadero waterfront!

oh, but you will leave smelling like a giant french fry.  consider yourself warned.
author: Emmy G.

description: Can't tell you how many times I went here for lunch during work, then got wasted on bloody marys. Love the burgers (any can be made into a turkey burger) and love the drinks. Can be hard to find a table, but if you're in the area, well-worth the wait. Stay away from the Jaeger though...
author: Sabine S.

description: Good Grub, great sandwiches, outdoor seating (but limited).  Casual environment but not a dive bar.  Good experience everytime I'm there.  Would warrant one more star if the service was faster than slooow.
author: B R.

description: I left Grumpy's a little grumpy.  Their burgers are mouthwatering.  I usually order the Baja and it never disappoints.  Their fries are good as well.. not the best out there but I like them.  Their service though leaves something to be desired.  I've always gone when it was super packed so I figure their service suffered due to the overwhelming amount of people.  But when I went today, there were only a couple other tables and it was still difficult to get our waitress to make an appearance at our table.  We eventually had to hail down the busboy to get us refills and to-go boxes.  And on that note, they charge for refills.  I don't know a lot of restaurants that still charge for refills so I'm not a huge fan of those places that nickle and dime their customers.  Burgers are on the pricier side but like I mentioned at the beginning, they are mouthwatering so I would definitely still order their burgers.. but maybe just to-go.
author: Jessica W.

description: Best burgers in town cooked perfectly and the meat is what ground beef should taste like.  I'm not sure if you have had fresh ground beef, but it will have a hint of sweetness to it and melt in your mouth.  The Boddingtons is my favorite beer to wash down the burger with the fries or salad or onion rings or baked potato skins.  The prime rib sandwich is also something to try the next time you are there.
author: victor s.

description:
I write my reviews, usually, when I want to gripe - not often enough to pay a compliment - and this is no exception. 
Been eating at Grumpy's once a month or so for a few years - usually take out for a working lunch. I'll call in the order about 11:30 for a noon pickup - usually it's only a five minute wait when I go to pick it up. 

Not this time.

Apparently they screwed up, and made the tuna sandwich I ordered, but forgot the hamburger. Shit happens. But I say apparently because they never told me anything about a delay. Five minutes....ten minutes...finally I grab someone to find out what's going on. They tell me the burger is being made. 
It's 12:20, more than 40 minutes after placing the order that I get my food.
And worse than all that - they were rude about the whole thing!!
As they finally gave me my food - still no explanation, the waitress gives a bland "sorry for the wait, hey can I give you a chili or a soup or something". As I'm about to walk out the door with the overdue order. 
I told her, "I just want to get out to my meeting, the time for a gesture like that would have been ten minutes ago while I was standing there like an idiot" and she got all snippy with me. 
Time to find a new burger joint
author: Mark S.

description:
Wow, I have a feeling I'm not in Kansas any more. Or am I? I used to come here back in 2005 and had nothing but great service and good vibes. I met old coworkers from that era tonight and suddenly, I'm in the movie "Deliverance". "drop them britches, come on now..." 

Seriously. The bartender had a buddy that continued to call me every variation of f@9 over the course of an hour. I placated the guy offering to buy him drinks until he combusted into a rage of anti-f@9ness and the bartenders (both male and female) told me to take a free drink and leave. Ultimately the bartender asked me "who am I" to be there, "we don't know you" and laid down the law for me. I had no right to be there cause his fraternity buddy felt that he should reconcile my "gayness" with the sword of the lord.

Funny, my wife watched in horror at the table on the side. Nice work Grumpy's employees! If I ever thought of being g@y, you taught me otherwise!
author: blue r.

description: Good place for lunch on a weekday!  Really good burgers, turkey burgers included-I am a fan
author: Bronwyn B.

description: Used to eat here for lunch when I worked in the financial district. I would always build my burger and have a side of garlic fries. This place is very loud, but if you can stand the noise, it offers good food, friendly service, and makes you want to keep coming back.
author: Chris Y.

description: i bumped into this hidden little bar one day and boy is it hidden. its right near all the TV stations and always has just enough people not to feel empty. great beer selection.
author: Michelle I.

description: For a hole in the wall the food is quite expensive! The waiters are pretty rude. We were waiting to get served for at least 20 minutes and the manager asked a waitress to serve us and she gave us a dirty look and flat out said, "no,"  probably because we were minorities. Overall the food is OK but not worth the price, the place is too loud, and the service sucks. Never will I come here again. I guess I know why it's called Grumpy's!
author: Kan P.

description: I haven't been here yet but word is that it's "Dirty Jobs" host Mike Rowe's favorite bar in the city.  I'll check it out just to have the chance to run into him!
author: Judith S.

description: this is the closest and most affordable restaurant thats close to my work.  its a small pub and always rather busy.  if you like  smaller crowd go around 11:30 or past 1.  they have a wide variety of burgers, fried deliciousness, sandwiches and beers.  they have speciality burgers and you can get beef, turkey or veggie so thats a good option.  so even though its got a lot of fried fatty deliciousness foods, you can still opt for a healthier option (although im not 100% sure why you would).  try the burger with the fried egg on top, its to die for.  anyway i probably go here twice a week for lunch at least so of course i think its above par.  or im that lazy...
author: Tiffany L.

description: totally reliable if you're in the hood and looking for pub food. good grilled cheese and tuna melt. love the tuna burger popeye style - feta and spinach - yum! if you're hungover at work and need a bit of grease hit it up.
author: Sarah R.

description: love love. great burgers and great monday-wed drink deals. also, doesn't hurt that its right by work! giving 4 stars because its not the cleanest place in the world...
author: Kwixxy S.

description: My hat is off at Grumpy's! This place is legit, great food, oh my god, great food. The burger here is damn good. If this is your first visit go Burger or Cheeseburger medium rare and dont even look back. The juice coming out of their burgers is exactly the way a burger should be, juicy! The meat to bun ratio favors the meat, a huge plus. Great fries, free refills on your sodas when your just trying for business in the front, but god forbid you ruffle the party in the back for a drink special Monday - Friday like a $7 beer and a Jameson shot, which kick starts my mullet. The food menu is great pub food, burgers, grilled sandwiches, god if you like BLT's, who doesnt, its awesome. They have TV's on the wall for you viewing pleasure and a fun comfortable atmosphere. May I recommend you get here before 11:45AM, as any financial district favorite goes, this one is BUTT SLAMMED for M-F lunch. Dont be afraid to call in your order and take this set up back to your desk, leave the leftover Lasagna at home!
author: Michael G.

description: its small & its a bit out of the way but the bartenders kick ass as does the bar food!
author: Inome C.

description: yeah theres a garbage can in the front of the place. yeah you get bad service if you ask stupid ass questions like splitting bills or my hamburger isnt 'garnished right', or the funniest one, 'im not comfortable in my table. can i take that table for 4'? its a busy ass PUB you asses. what do you expect?  but like it or not, this place has one of the best burgers in the financial district. thats why its always busy. ive never recieved bad service here, never had bugs on my salad,  or had anyone of these good, down to earth people 'roll' their eyes at me. maybe its cause i dont act like a trust fund baby and expects them to wipe my mouth for me.
author: erick m.

description: I had a great lunch at Grumpy's today.  I was looking for a perfectly poured pint of Guiness and something good to eat.  Grumpy's delivered with an excellent turkey pastrami reuben.  The house salad instead of fries was great, too (lots of good stuff, not iceberg lettuce with a tomato wedge).  And, the service was great, with a friendly staff.  I'll be back.
author: Shaun R.

description: this place had good service, but the food was ~$10.00 and it was just mediocre. I would recommend going there to drink some of there assorted beers first, then order some food when you're too drunk to know any better
author: rick l.

description: Started going to this place about 4 years ago. Not once has it disappointed me ever since. By far, the best burger I have tasted. The burger patty is juicy, flavorful and fulfilling. I have tasted Burger Bistro, Burger Meister, Nations Burger, In-N-Out Burgers, Barney's, Redrum(Murder) Burger etc and none have exceeded my expectation as much as Grumpys did. Not to mention the delicious mouth watering fries that accompany the wonderful burger. It is heaven on a plate. In fact, the whole menu is freaking awesome. If you crave a simple grilled cheese with fries like I do, Grumpys! If you crave Fried Chicken & Mash Potatoes, Grumpys! If you crave chicken wings or a nice green salad, Grumpys! Overall, best pub food by far. Oh and you can get shit faced there too.
author: Petey L.

description: seems that quality has gone down and prices have gone up and portions have gotten smaller...sad to see something that was really good become pricy and not worth the effort.  someone please put another restaurant that doesn't suck near here.
author: Heidi h.
